+ Overall gameplay is unmatched.

= The graphic is exactly the same with 2020.
= Not significantly improved gameplay. (Personally, prefer 2020.)

- No longer available for sale (just... why?)
- Optimization is painfully bad(Eating CPU like hell).
- AI FOUL is an absolute bullshed.
- Online play is over.

Overall, it's a good investment, but many people weren't lucky enough to buy it in time. And the modding community is just incredible (nothing to do with KONAMI lol)

If you are interested in playing the career mods, don't bother. You'll just have to wait until an actual good football game comes up. Efootball 21, along with other modern football games, is utter garbage. Scripting is ridiculous. You have minimal control over the game, and that is being generous. The game has a scenario for matches for what is going to happen and everything that will happen the game is designed to serve this scenario the game has pre-calculated. There is genuine bad intentions here. Football game players are used to the games being scripted at this point. But because Konami has some of the worst programmers out there, they failed so miserably at hiding it. Everything happens so blatantly and they didn't even bother trying to make the scripting fit into a context. Each action that occurs in the game has a predetermined result and how you will act barely changes anything. This will be even more obvious in BAL mode because you control a single player and you can easily observe how things happen. There will be times the game activates some sort of a toggle for a certain time period and as long as this toggle is active, your player will not be able to receive the ball no matter what. Your teammates will pass to unrelated locations even though you stay stationary, your player will fall down just before receiving the ball for no reason, the opponents will foul you and the ref will award the foul to them, you will tackle the ball from the opponent, but your player will trip over nothing and lose the ball et cetera. Each position's result is already determined, there are barely any instances that happen spontaneously. When your teammate gets the ball, the game already knows if the player is supposed to lose possession or not in that position. If the game dictates that he will lose the possession, then nothing will change. If you pull a nice move and manage to get the ball before your opponent, then your next pass will go directly to the opponent no matter how you pass it, because in the memory the game sees that in that certain time period, your opponent is supposed to have the possession. These are only a fraction of the scripting. Do not buy it.

All my love for real football gets amplified in this game. Feels natural in comparison to FIFA. Community created mods have opened up endless hours of enjoyment for me, there simply is no other football game that comes close, including konami's latest release of efootball.

PROS :
- game pace feels great
- Looks decent enough

CONS :
- HEAVILY scripted. CANNOT emphasize that it enough!
- Lower rated clubs play WAY above average.
- Getting a "clean sheet" is the most impossible feat to achieve.
- Player controls during "scripting events" are ridiculous
- refs are absolutely broken. Most of the fouls received aren't even called, and play-on's are more often a hindrance than an advantage. Your "fouls" on the other hand are hilarious to the point of frustration
- This game is more 'work' than it is fun. Winning or losing should NOT be this stressful

This game is not rewarding. I'd argue and say it isn't fun. No matter what you do, whatever players you have or put in, nothing will beat the 'script' if it is time for it to happen. I can't stress that enough. This game is a burden and nothing but 'stress' fuel. It's a real shame what Winning Eleven has become.

Everyone loves the Master League Mode so I wont go into that but the Become a Legend mode is possibly the most in depth RPG I have ever played on a computer. Every stat matters and has a direct impact in how the character plays on a live field down to even what foot he uses as the dominant one. Every stat, every skill, how tall you are, how much you weigh and even what positions you play all completely change your experience. I highly recommend it.

Such a shame. This game looks great, and there's some nice features to it, but the refereeing is terrible and the sloppiness of the players is infuriating. Every 50/50 challenge results in a free kick for the opposition, whereas I've managed to go several games without even getting one, despite being on the end of seemingly identical tackles. I've been playing football games for years and this is the first time I've ever asked for a refund. There is a lot to like about the rest of the game, I like the master league format and the training drills are good mini games, but that one fundamental aspect being implemented so poorly makes all the good parts irrelevant. I'm not massively into playing online or the 'iconic moment' stuff, but I didn't get the game for that, so I can't comment on it. I just wanted to play the master league with some consistent refereeing!

UPDATE:
Since, according to Steam, 2 hours is the time limit for a refund (understandable for small games, not so much here), I reinstalled the game, since I wasn't getting my money back, I thought I might as well give it another chance. I decided to try the 'Become A Legend' mode, which was a mistake! This might be the worst implemented game mode in a game where they've got so much wrong already. For a start, you don't get a choice of which club to start at, not an immediately obvious one (I actually opened the game up again to check before posting this, there's definitely no choice) . Want to be a legend, starting in the premier league, I hope you're a West Brom fan! (I am not, I support Villa, the last thing I want to do is waste the first part of my career at a rival club) . If it was at least randomised, at least I could either reset to get the team I'd like to play for, or at least one I won't hate playing for. If it was justified by saying "but new players generally don't get much choice of which club they start at", they don't choose which team to beg for a transfer to either, but that also happens here. 

 So, anyway, let's just start in the championship. Fine, Wycombe, let's go, and let's not take this seriously and make a giant of a player and have him be a target man. What's this? This giant, brutish man can't win headers against men half his size? He gets lots of practice, since your teammates are constantly pumping it upfield, to the opposite side of the pitch from where you are. Wait, this time, I've recieved a ball to feet, with back to goal. Now if I can just take a quick touch and turn, I'll be in. What's this? My man is taking a year to turn around? Maybe it's because he's a giant, but this also happens with springy, athletic players, so I'd say it's just more that dribbling is awful. Every player has the rotation speed  and turning circle of a fucking planet (unless it's the computer playing against you, of course, then they have a lightning touch). 

 The reason I logged as many hours as I did was because I really tried to see if it was me. I expect to lose the odd game, but I at least expect a chance. That is, a chance without either lowering the difficulty and winning 5-0 at Old Trafford with the standard Villa team, or Jack Grealish having all the ability of Habib Beye, even against much lesser opposition. Seriously, why have football games never got the concept that turning the difficulty up is supposed to make the opposition better, not turn what were godly paragons of the game in one match into a hungover pub league team in the next.

Maybe other players having this issue are in a similar place. Maybe they support a less fashionable team and the big team bias is still a curse of football games. Maybe all the people posting positive reviews play as elite teams and see no problems. Maybe they've only been playing football games in recent years, and weren't around when football games were actually good (yes, even FIFA!). Maybe the problems really are with us... Nope, it is genuinely fixed. I actually nerfed the squads of the elite premier league teams, and they were still getting the rub of the green in every way. The game takes no notice of player ratings and squad chemistry, it just calculates that the elite teams have an advantage. Your players make mistakes all the time, are second best in every area, and players on the other team with ratings in the low 70s are running rings around my team now full of superstars. If that doesn't prove they have a bias programmed in, I don't know what will.

But it's pretty telling that a frequent comment amongst even the good reviews is "there's some problems, but it's still better than FIFA". Being better than that turgid shite is not hard, and this game is still not good. PES 6 is better than even modern FIFA games, saying this is better than FIFA isn't even a review of this game, it's a review of FIFA. Between this and FIFA, I'm genuinely losing interest in football games. Damn Konami, you've managed to kill a nearly 30 year hobby!

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

ePES2021 or 2020 plays similar/identical, and i enjoyed it the most when playing against human opponent. 

But sadly what i want to play is the Master League, and this is where the problem lies. 
The main problem in ePES2021 is the AI feels scripted, especially at higher level. 
Player Ratings wont matter, because AI will intercept all your passes, catch up your most agile strikers, the keeper will mostly saved the most difficult shot you made, and never get a card from a mean foul, never offside when the enemy strikers already infront of your defender, etc etc. 
You already 4-0 lead at the halftime and guess what, the AI defeat you in the second half with most of your defender just dissapear into nowhere. 
But if you lower the difficulty the game felt too easy 

I guess that's why they made ePES, because the developer didn't seem capable to create enjoyable AI opponent anymore. 

Back in time my Michael Owen of England in Winning Eleven with 9 rating of speed, if he beat your defender, there's no way the opponent could catch you
Batigol and Adriano did had the scariest long shot ability
Baggio, Zidane, Del Piero feels elegant when controlling the ball

Back then I didn't feel cheated with the AI.

Hi Folks,
I am confused. I noticed something in my steam library:
pes 2016 529h
pes 2015 458h
pes 2017 391h
pes 2018 160h

in 2019 i played the demo and the negative changes was even bigger, so i decided to skip a year. But in 2020 there was no change and 2021 was just an update. 
Then came efootball 2022!

I'm going back a step now:

I skip PES 2014 because there was an new Engine - just like 2008.
From 2008 to 2013 there were good developments with the exception of PES 2010 (a disaster). 

Before that was PES 6, often called legendary. PES 5 was problematic because of the referee, 4 was action heavy, 3 rock solid, 2 an improvement and the first part an evolution of ISS.

I played all these parts but something must have happened? I just re-installed 16, 17 & 18 to see - are there any differences? And to be honest: there are hardly any (in short term)! 

At first i thought the importance of online gaming, the competition to EA had hurt the series. I'm not sure, maybe i've changed too. I'm no longer willing to forgive the weaknesses this series has always had. 

After 25 years, i can no longer find stratgic solutions on the pitch. Creativity is no longer in demand, although the possibilities haven't changed at all. Something happened.

Cheers!

IMHO, the game is pretty fine, but the mechanics is totally ruined. 

You cant perform 1-2 chemistry in this game anymore, the player is either too slow for a return pass or perform it poorly. The only way to score in this game is to do a lofted pass and HOPEFULLY the opponent defender will miss the ball and your striker can score. Goalkeeper IQ is lowered, no more insane save, which I think it's a good thing. 

Defending in this game suck too, all you need to do is run toward the ball since 1-2 chemistry is removed, defending now is just about who has better balance, and guess what, your defender always win. 

Crossing is a pain in the ass when you cant perform a quick cross but the player has to take a step back and cross like an amateur chicken on every Sunday league. I'm not sure if it's just me or it's the game design,  but I have extreme input lag. I cant just quick press the button then override it to trick the other player or perform a quick 1-2 anymore, I have to wait for at least 1 second after the player receive the ball that I can do something about it. 

As a long time PES player, I found this game's mechanic suck, but I think newbies will like it since it's easier to score and approach.

I really want to recommend the game but the online experience ruins everything. The matches are scripted. You can be winning 2-0 up and suddenly your defenders stop running and you lose 2 goals in 1min. 

There are too many exploits that opponents use that you can do nothing about. Goals can be scored from kick off everything by giving a through ball to the striker. One of one with the keeper? The opponent will do a sliding tackle from the back and won't even get a red card for it. 

When these things don't happen, the games can be satisfying. But the frustration is simply not worth the few moments of fun.

Edit:

[b]Graphics[/b]
The stadiums of this game look fantastic and incredibly realistic, sadly enough there are not that many licensed. 
Scanned faces of players look very realistic and a big step up from FIFA. The generated faces aren't even close to being as good and sometimes show a completely different person to what he looks like in real life. 
The pitch is not that good looking and too vibrant. As this is the main thing you look at it is quite disappointing that it is not realistic. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
This is hands down the very best experience I have had playing vanilla eFootball. The previous versions didn't quite feel right but this one clicked right away. The players are responsive, the ball physics are [i]sublime[/i], and it feels amazing to play a long lofted pass across the pitch. 
The collisions could use some improvement as there are often no fouls given as the collision isn't registered as a foul. Lastly the animations of the players are really good and the game engine often comes up with wicked animations to pick up the ball from behind a player or in the air, really good stuff. 
Multiplayer is not advanced, the connection is reasonable but not via servers but peer-to-peer, so the slightest of bad connections will influence it massively. Players are online enough for sub 1 minute waiting times, 
Offline gamemodes are well worked and incredibly enjoyable to play. The career mode features fun short "video's" to announce a transfer or a derby match coming up and I wish they explored this further in an update. 

[b]Sound[/b]
It's nothing special, the soundtrack is alright, but I prefer my own music. The crowd is good and brings more immersion into the match. It requires mods to really take it to the next level. 

[b]Mods[/b]
This is one of the largest en best modding communities out there. [b]Every single things[/b] has a mod for it. After installing about 150gb of mods you get every single stadium in the world, nearly all players have a face and all the new team kits are added and automatically selected, 
The graphics look [i]next-gen[/i] with fog mods and an extremely realistic pitch which completely transform the look of the game. 
Even the gameplay can be tuned to your liking to remove the bits of scripting which exist in the base game. 
With mods this is hands down the very best football game ever, [b]9/10[/b]. 

[b]Verdict: 7/10[/b]
The base game has good gameplay and alright graphics, it really requires the mods to take it to the next level. The multiplayer experience is ok, but not on the level of FIFA. 
Offline you have infinite options and terabytes of mods to install and explore!

I find the physics of the game relatively realistic. You have to properly position your players for proper ball movement and power. Cross attacks and free kick wall jumps implement timed button presses to work.

The game could use better orientation and tutorials in the beginning since I am not versed in soccer tactics and strategies. A lot of the options to manage your team aren't explicitly explained.

They also don't tell you where to setup basic, advance, semi-advance controls and how they work. Or, they don't tell you not every type of shot skill is available right away for players.

Overall, I enjoy the game much more than the FIFA franchise.

Look; This game is abusively fun. However, would I recommend it to people? Probably not. Take for instance the Become a Legend mode. PES's mainstay offline mode for lots of people since FIFA has a similar, but much subpar, mode with their player careers. Would you imagine that your 99 rated superstar who has 99 dribbling, speed, and acceleration could outrun and out dribble nearly every defender in the game? Well tough. You're locked, momentum cancelled, fouled with impunity, all because the game just decides a 39yr old defender will outpace a new 25yr old striker who runs faster than the entire team when off the ball, but then you get on the ball and age 70yrs and lose your left leg. This is obviously something that personally bothers me, but the 'spirit' mechanic (or wtf they call their scripting that decides you'll lose your game whenever they want) absolutely ruins moments. At one point I remember forcing the enemy team to score because in a UCL FINAL they were down 12-0 and then the next season I faced the team again in the round of 16 and was down 3-0 by the first half. Same team, same aggression levels, same home-away statuses, same everything and then suddenly a 3 and a half star Swiss team suddenly has an act of god and survives? In what world does that happen? In a world where scripting and poor game mechanics were less important fixes that microtransactions and their E-Sports Scene. Honestly Konami has taken a franchise that once was able to counter FIFA in some places and had genuinely amazing modes that had potential. Fix the mechanics, fix the refs, actually add things to master league and BAL. Stop trying to force an e sports scene that doesnt really exist for this game in the way FIFA does.

The last version of PES to see light, not the last Konami product to be "not recommended". Online glitches, network abusers, hackers and such are just a drop in the ocean of the issues the game actually has in its core gameplay. Scripting. It was present for a while now, but it has never actually been that bad. Here, you can literally feel and see, when game decides that you no longer deserve to play it as you want: players become sloppy, they wiggle around when switched to, they respond slower, they run away from the free ball, game deliberatly doesnt let you control the player closest to the deflected ball, defense suddenly drops from 90 rated to 30 rated or something, because they tackle with a delay of 1+ second. When the game works as the fans want - PES is good, but random scripting interacting with your gameplay online and offline is just beyond one`s patience. I`m honestly tired of having dice rolls decide if I m allowed to have fun or should I suffer, watching the game cheat on me or my foes (yes, scripting is so bad, that you can feel it even when your opponents have their bad luck).

At least, this version is so much better than PES 22.

Scripting was always annoying in PES, but in this version of PES you get the feeling that what you do with the gamepad and you team has nearly nothing to do with the outcome of the game. And as I said, it´s so totally unnecessary. The game would work perfectly without.  With this bad "design" decisions Konami slowly committed seppuko over the last years. And now they finally seem to have joined their ancestors with the last 2022 release. Rest in peace...

I have played many football games over the years. From Fifa, to PES (especially enjoyed the PES1 and PES5), to Championship and Football Manager. I have played them on many platforms like PS1, PS2, PS3, even Nintendo Switch. This is the first football game that's not Championship Manager or Football Manager that I bought for PC.

It has by far the WORST gameplay I have ever seen. It is just ridiculously bad, to the brink of just plain pathetic. I'm someone who likes to play fluent possession football, but this game just doesn't allow for it. Passing is off by miles. The amount of times simple passes like playing from CB to RB are so far off of where they should end it is just ridiculous. At first I thought it was me, but after checking on previous games on other platforms and playing exactly the same way I can only conclude it's this game itself.

Defending is the same pathetic excuse of a game. The amount of times I had a player right next to the ball, pushing on the button to "stand tackle" it or to kick the ball away, to then just let it see move by him. I can't keep count anymore. The game doesn't react at all at how it should. Headers go missing, passes go wide, tackling is sometimes completely disappeared. I have never seen a game react so badly (or even not reacting at all) on the input of the controller.

The only upside is that I bought it on sale for like 8 EUR. I've played almost 40h, because I feel you have to give a game a chance to grow on you, but this is just not worth it. It is a shame because I found the PES versions of the game on the PS2 very enjoyable, but this is just a ghost of the game it has been in the past. Will probably go back to FIFA after this shamble of a game.

Compared to the previous version, this one has a minor improvement (since it's just the season update). Graphics-wise, PES still has top-notch graphics, compared to a similar game (Yes, I'm talking to you FIFA). The only thing that bugs me until now is the fact that PES AI still sucks. Often times my defenders struggle to defend and believe me....It was the worst defensive unit ever since Harry Maguire - Victor Lindelof. Another thing Konami should consider is the player's cursor switching system. Back in the day, in PES 2013, they distinct it with 3 types of cursor switching: Assisted, manual, and semi-assist. Now, the Semi-assist is gone. For casual players, the lack of a semi-assist cursor mechanism is a pain in the arse. 

Is it worth buying? yes, but get in when it's on sale and wait for the newer version.

Almost everything in this game is 2020 roster update version but there are more players than the last installment; missing players and some players from reserve teams or team B.

Pros:
- Beautiful graphics. My PC can run this game although not a high-end PC.
- Stadiums in the game are gorgeous. Player models from LC teams are full of details (you can add faces for unlicensed ones later)
- There are many national teams in this game, especially all of European national teams and some from Latin and Asia are full licensed. (I like to play national teams as well as master league and cup mode)
- Able to use a patch or files to update real logos, kits, balls, competitions, faces, personnel and other things.
- Gameplay might be the same but, in my view, looks smoother than the last one.
- As a result of there are more players than the last one, it's possible to update rosters and others by patch or oneself for 2-3 years ahead.
- Reasonable price if it's on sale.

Cons:
- Sometimes I've felt AI's taken advantage of players e.g. refereeing, stamina, second ball etc.
- Can't launch the game if you have no internet connection. The worst point for me. Players should access the game whenever you want.
- The commentary is boring and repetitive. Looks like developers didn't improve or change anything. (I don't blame commentators but poor and cheesy scripts)

Neutral:
- I prefer single player mode. I don't care about online mode.
- This game might be suitable for players who love to modify, update or add anything in it.
- This is the last game calling PES. I prefer this name and gameplay. No interest in the next installment.

BEST GAME EVER , BETTER THAN EFOOTBALL

[h1] SINGLE PLAYER REVIEW [/h1]

I have played this game for hunderd of hours outside of steam. I'll admit this is my go-to football game because there is not much choice in the football market. However, I got more sadness and frustration out of this game than happiness but I keep coming back for it even after uninstalling, just like a toxic relationship. Here is why this game drives me crazy:

1. [b] Player stats dont matter against the AI. [/b] Your best winger cannot dribble through a random sunday league defender. Your monstrous defensive midfield with high strength cant outmuscle a small joe shielding the ball. While your fastest player will get outpaced by big smoke with 73 speed. Maybe its related to the scripting issue that others have been saying too in other reviews.

2. [b] Referee are bias af. [/b] AI almost always get a call while they can broke your player's leg and run away with it.

3. [b] Freekicks are OP. [/b]

4. In master league, the AI teams will always be a cheapskate and try to offer one of your best players in far less amount of his market value just because he "past his prime". Piss off.

5. Player ratings after the game is a joke.

Buy this game on our own sanity risk, or wait for sale.

This upgrade was absolutely worth the money for PES fans and, in general, everyone looking for a gameplay that feels like real football. 

Since the former season is gone, you may want to buy it for a large discount (like I did) or to just install the Lite version, in case you are going to play the game once in a while and are not interested in Master League, Become a Legend and so on.

This can't be perfect, but including video animation and textures, PES 2021 should be the best football game ever. I am willing to pay a reasonable price for the latest player transfer version, PES 2022, instead of playing efootball 2022 for free.

Gameplay + Manual Controls + Mods (esp gameplay & graphics)  = The greatest game ever

Overview
The core-gameplay, especially in Exhibition mode, is the greatest of all time. Combined with a plethora of mods from the PC editing community as well as a willingness to train yourself to use full manual controls, this is the greatest football video game ever released, regardless of what mode you're playing. Yes, better than PES 4, 5, 6 and even the legendary Winning Eleven 9: Liveware Evolution.

To be clear, a vanilla installation of this game is really not worth anyone's time beyond casual exhibition matches or offline multiplayer (which, if you can find a good opponent who plays with Full Manual controls, is an immense treat), so be prepared to get your hands dirty modding if you want to experience the true brilliance of this game.


Details
Proper PES fans will already understand that this isn't the game for those looking for flashy menus, expansive soundtracks, life-like commentary and stadium audio. Instead, it's always been the go-to game for those looking for the most authentic virtual representation of football, and Konami's been delivering precisely that for at least two extended periods of time: first in the PS2 generation and then recently with PES 2016-2020. Each of these latter editions has gotten progressively better and there's an argument to be had as to whether the PES 2020 Demo had the best gameplay of the bunch. Nevertheless, there's no doubt that the 2021 Season Update may offer most polished gameplay experience Konami has ever offered.

Yet still there is one massive issue that has held back each one of these recent titles. Whether you want to call it Scripting, Dynamic Difficulty or even just AI Cheating, it is undeniable that any match played outside of Exhibition mode has *something* interfering with what otherwise would be a pure competitive contest. You need not look any further than football supporters' reactions to the European "Super League" plans announced earlier this year  to understand how important the idea of sporting integrity is to football. Therefore, having to deal with a constantly changing gameplay experience due to intentionally engineered and concealed game engine manipulations throughout a Master League campaign is truly a game-breaking issue. This is further exacerbated by the fact that the underlying "pure" game engine is the best ever developed. 

The gold standard for a football, or any other sport, video game is that the game should never give you an excuse to feel that a loss isnot your fault. That is, the player should always feel completely in control and 100 percent responsible for any positive or negative outcome. Fortunately, the modding community has come to the rescue with a plethora of dt18 and exe edits that take various approaches from setting Team Spirit to 0 in all Master League matches to having the game engine process all matches as Exhibition matches, thus going a very long way to completely nullifying these issues. The result is a Master League experience that has the potential to consume your life, especially when paired with other ML mods that completely remove any hint of licensing gaps.

In addition to these mods, full manual controls will completely change your perception of what a football video game is. If you play football in real life, especially on natural grass pitches, you'll understand that every pass and shot requires a certain level of concentration and technique to move the ball exactly as you want into the *space* you want. This idea of manipulating space, not with your movements as a player but with your passing placement, technique (i.e., elevation) and power, has been nearly perfectly captured by Konami. There's no doubt this requires a some practice (although much less than I originally thought), but the reward is immense. You will quickly realize how simplistic and limiting assisted controls are and how much more rewarding and dynamic their manual counterparts are. If you're still not sure, just give it a shot playing as different teams with varying levels. You'll quickly notice how the game engine feels as though it was primarily designed for manual controls, as things that weren't possible before now feel like second nature, and differences in players' passing ability and style are perfectly balanced between being too pronounced and inconsequential.

Simply put, I believe the greatest thing to ever happen in the PES series is that Konami gave themselves an extra year, not to put together a great next-gen title (let's not get into the eFootball debacle), but to give us the most polished gameplay engine of all time that can serve as a foundation for some breathtaking mods for many years to come. With gameplay mods, near infinite stadiums, reshade presets, etc, etc, I will happily play this game for the next 10 years.

FIFA on SNES, PES on PS1, PS2, PS3, FIFA on PS4/PC and didn't like the way unrealistic passing and running of FIFA and changed to PES and never looked back.

Gameplay is realistic to me (but it has its own quirks).

Its quirks include
- difficult in switching player (more prominent in scripted play)
- user players watching ball (even when the ball is coming in his way by accident)
- user players' heading is more difficult than acrobatic kick by AI
- scripted play by AI 
    * you can't do nothing to prevent AI from scoring a goal
    * your CB can tackle but will trip (or CB/GK pass to opponent CF)
    * your AMF (with 99 pass ability) passes to CB or GK
    * your CF (93 rated) kicks the ball too wide on open goal

The above quirks can be overcome by
- a lot of cancellation
- advanced shooting/passing

I am still trying to adopt to advanced shooting/passing and haven't achieved yet.

Overall the game is not bad but it feels like there have been some serious steps backwards in the gameplay. I played PES from the very beginning until 2014, then stopped and played again this year. I'm only playing 1vs1 local matches with friends. After all these years I expected more. Player movements are not as smooth and realistic as they used to be, it feels like there's some sort of post movement correction that makes players be where they are supposed to rather than where the action and animations brought them. Some animations are really good but some are not and the transition between animations is sometimes snappy.
The physics of player collision is acceptable but doesn't shine. Things like players pulling adversaries by their shirt are nice but visually broken with the 3d models just intersecting.
Overall decent but not acceptable if you think about the whole progress of the game throughout the years.

I've played these games for nearly a decade on and off. The thing i've realized is that if you're looking for a good game that recreates the game of football, you won't find it. Both fifa and this game fail at it. These are poor games, but i do want to commend the creators because if they both haven't got it right, i guess its impossible and they try. They do a good job, this game more than its competitor, but fall short in frustrating ways. I don't recommend these games due to my experience but ill try to prepare any potential buyers as best i can.
A.I. 
The A.I. in this game fights you on almost everything you do. Do you want to make an interception? Do you want to run to get the through ball? Do you want to but your player inbetween the attacker and the goal to prevent a shot? How about making an offensive run? The answer to all those questions is no. The intelligence will not let you do any of those things. 

To summarize, these games will most likely never be sufficient enough to enjoy.

English and French review:

ENG:
Not a great simulation but,
More "realistic" than Fifa (it's as boring as a true match from the L1) but PES is still animated with a broom in the ass (facial and racing), for example the rig bones of the hands almost never used, almost none muscle animation on the face like in Fifa, which gives on PES the impression of a constipation of the players when they shoot or are tackled.

But there is as much shenanigans (if not more) as Fifa like long pass from the goalkeeper to the Striker with 99 speed close to the defense, which make a goal.

Expect slow game, a ball made in lead metal, players stumbling and stoping like GTA PNJ when you walk to another player, slow player moving like tank, rigid gameplay and not speed sensation like when you watching Mbappe or Son, and animation with very slow timing and rarely immediate action, some ball cant be lost for stupid reasons and shielding is bad in this game.

When you pass the other move weirdly (360 move, still going forward, stopping) you need mostly to do short pass

The player can also lost the ball very easily for nothing; game control are not that great but the defense is more auto and easy than fifa.

pressing is very assited compared to Fifa, now i understand why they don't do the old pressing on Fifa because it will make you catch the ball without effort.

The modelling has an engine that sublimates a lot of things, but the modelling is still very rough on some players and badly proportioned. Fifa caught up on this point when PES was using the Fox Engine for the first time but PES remains the best scans of great players, you can't compare Dembélé PES(scanned) with the one on Fifa21(a true disrespect).

The players with the most details are the players of the clubs proposed by efootball season pack, they were scanned thanks to photgrametry.
But fifa got some details that PES doesnt have, for exemple PES miss tthe tattoo of players while fifa got them.
Fifa also does something  better is the physionomy, you can't compare the shaqiri of Fifa (packed) and PES(slim), thanks to a better modularity for the body model on the Fifa engine, the base model of PES as weird proportion with the hands also.
You can still mod it and make it better and realistic models.

Fifa has a more fluid and fast game, PES is very timed for each action; the animation for the control and such can last several seconds, the handling of dribbling on PES is not crazy.
The players of eaFIFA respond better to the ball and its trajectories with different controls which PES does poorly.

The sound level is better in many aspects of Fifa.

The AI is much more interesting and the players' placements more fluid, that's where the difference takes place, Fifa remains arcade and not very smart, PES favors the collective game and a very advanced game simulation.

The handling is not top in my humble opinion, I always had more affinity with fifa since the PS1 and especially the way of dribbling, the ball protection is auto on PES.

Very few modes unlike Fifa 21, but its strength remains in its style of play and the tackles are real sliding tackles unlike Fifa where the player stumbles on a banana, it's also a less fragility players simulator than Fifa, here, player can still continue after being flicked by a guy. 

The physic changed a lot of things i was happy that was finally put but never tried on fifa or PES but it's a new way to play with very strange problem but yet very cool, i never thought it will be so easy to fall for players even with a tiny touch tho (more falling on FIFA).

My club just like Fut is a cash grabber where you make your team but i feel it's a lesser cash grabber than EA vision.

You can still troll by placing your players in a weird way (full front and full back) and win easily, the realistic way is killed by this kind of gameplay but it's a game.

Both remain very interesting and different, depending on your desire to play seriously (PES) or like to stumble but have fun with others (Fifa) you will prefer one more than the other.

But like fifa Pace is the most important value.

The gameplay is not fun never was but was more slow paced and thoughtful, fifa got more animations and actions for the ball, most people saying PES is better gameplay wise are old players of PES, the true is... Fifa got more fluid actions than PES and more possibilites i'm also an old player of PES (6 was great) but the true is Fifa got more gameplay (and adds) than this old and rigid man called PES who still got the same animations pattern from ISS.

You can unpack the best players easily and with less money than fifa, your players can evolve in skills after match and training and the virtual money can you give lots of pack for exemple 8 euros for more than 10 unpacking of best players like Mbappé and such while Fifa make you pay more than 20 euros for ONE premium pack.
======

FR:
Plus réaliste que son comparse Fifa mais toujours animé avec un balai dans le cul (facial et course), exemple les rig bones des mains quasi-jamais utilisé, pas de muscle animation comme dans fifa sur les visage ce qui donne l'impression d'une constipation des joueurs quand il tire ou se font tacler.

La modélisation joui d'un moteur qui sublime pas mal de chose, mais la modélisation reste très approximatif sur certains joueurs; Fifa a rattrapé son retard sur ce point; un retard lorsque PES utilisais pour la première fois le Fox Engine, mais PES garde les meilleures scans des grands joueurs, suffit de comparer Dembélé sur PES et Fifa21(un manque de respect t'as peur).

Les joueurs Fifa possèdent plus de détails et traits physiques sur un plus large nombres de joueurs non connus et il non pas une conjonctivite avec des yeux vitreux... il manque aussi des détails que Fifa possède comme les tatouages.

Les joueurs les plus détaillés sont les joueurs des clubs proposés par le efootball season pack, ils ont été scannés grâce à la photogrammétrie.
Fifa fait également quelque chose de mieux, c'est la physionomie, vous ne pouvez pas comparer le shaqiri de Fifa (tassé) et PES(maigre), et ça grâce à une meilleure modularité pour le modèle de corps sur le moteur de Fifa, le modèle de base de PES à des  proportions bizarres notamment avec les mains.
Vous pouvez toujours utiliser des mods et rendrer cela plus réaliste.

Fifa possède un jeu plus fluide et rapide, PES est très temporisé ou chaque action de l'animation pour le contrôle etc peu durer plusieurs secondes, la maniabilité des dribbles sur PES n'est pas folle.
Les joueurs eaFIFA répond mieux au ballon et ses trajectoires avec différents controles ce que PES fait mal.

Niveau sonore ça explose sur beaucoup de points Fifa.

L'IA est largement plus intéressante et les placements des joueurs plus fluide c'est la ou la différence à lieu, Fifa reste arcade et très peu malin, PES privilégie le jeu collectif et une simulation de jeu très poussé.

La maniabilité n'est pas top à mon humble avis, j'ai toujours eu plus d'affinité avec les fifa depuis la PS1 et surtout la façon de dribbler, la protection de balle est auto sur PES.

Très peu de mode contrairement à Fifa 21, mais sa force reste dans son style de jeu et les tacles sont des vraies tacles glissé contrairement à Fifa ou le joueur trébuche sur une banane. 

Les deux reste très intéressant et différent, selon vos envie de jouer sérieusement(PES) ou aimer trébucher mais s'amuser à plusieurs (Fifa) vous aller privilégier l'un plus que l'autre. Fifa reste très bien animé et propose plus de contenu et une maniabilité plus intéressante.

Mais comme dans fifa, la rapidité est la valeur la plus importante.

Plus:
Bande musicales pas folle comme d'hab pour PES à part deux trois musiques qui sortent du lot.

"Disappointing Season"

Technical analysis summary

Graphics: 7.0
Sound: 6.0
Playability: 8.0
Longevity: 6.5
Impact: 6.0

Pro

- Budget price
- All the usual editability
- As always, a more realistic and staid approach to football simulation
- Minor, but useful, gameplay improvements

Cons

- No new game modes or game mechanics
- Interest in online multiplayer drastically wanes after a couple of weeks due to lack of content...
- ...due to a total absence of new game modes and very few online objectives capable of keeping attention and desire of playing high
- Overall, the technical sector needs a breath of fresh air and this has never been more tangible than this year


Overall Verdict

6.7: The usual satisfying and pleasant football simulation capable of entertaining enough fans of football video games.
No news worthy of note compensated by the reduced price, if you have played the previous PES you will have fun as usual and you will even be able to appreciate some minor positive tweaks, but we look forward to the development of the next game hoping to finally be able to see noteworthy improvements.
Recommended to PES fanatics and to those who have never approached Konami's football game before.

I've absolutely had it with this game!
Yes, it's an improvement to last year but that just goes to show what a pile of trash pes20 was.
- Referees are still absolute shambles. This has been an issue for YEARS, Konami!
- Why do I have to be online even if I just play Master League?
- For the love of god, please remove that annoying opera song that comes on before cup games and derbies!
- Players would not leave their position if their life depended on it "Nah sry fam can't help you on that counter, I'm a rightback" and will just stop mid-movement
- Players would rather die than intercept a pass, unless it's your own pass to a different player
- Player selection is terrible! HOW DO YOU MESS UP PLAYER SELECTION?? (EA did this better in 2004)
- Playing on higher difficulties basically turns every opposition sunday league fatty into prime Inzaghi
- How come, everytime I have two of my players in front of me, the one that goes towards my pass is ALWAYS the one thats offside?
- I've seen french cars respond faster to controller inputs than my Players
- Every real-life braindead rat has a better first touch than anyone on this game
- It's ridiculous how much easier it is to beat an actual top team than teams with a bad rating. Barcelona etc will actually attack and try to play. Bad teams only defend but are doing a better job than the best in the world. And if you happen to play on a higher difficulty you are very likely to concede from every counter attack.
I don't really know what i expected for 25€ after last year's game but it was certainly not this, which is sad because somewhere hiding underneath all this garbage is probably a decent game that just needs some fixing

Edit: Data Pack 4
I am glad to announce, it is one of those rare times where a data pack actually improved the game.
The players react way faster to the inputs, which makes the game actually - dare I say it - fun!
This is arguably the best change that ever happened to the game. However, there are still a lot of issues.
- Refs still bad
- Youth system in Master League is still horrible (Please, steal this feature from FIFA). Nobody wants the same youth players for every single Master League
- Player selection needs a lot of improvement, especially for full manual controls
- Free kicks are extremely satisfying, but waaay too easy to score from
I assume they will continue to tweak a lot of mechanics, so everything is set for the next-gen game and if they continue the way they did with Data pack 4, I will definitely consider giving PES22 a go.

Edit 2:

I'll keep it short and sweet. I've been a FIFA man for years and years, so this was a big step to give PES a proper crack for the first time. Obviously, there never going to be any way to avoid comparing the two.

Visuals are great, but the presentation definitely doesn't live up to the FIFA standard. Commentary has always been a PES problem and it shows. The career mode is a hell of a lot more stream lined in the sense that it can be as in-depth or as basic as you like. The licensed roster is pretty good, filling in some of the FIFA gaps these days. Like most, I would have to say the game-play itself is a win over FIFA big time. Controls are a hell of a lot more responsive with some very nice physics to boot.

Overall, I still very much loved PES and FIFA, they both have their pros and cons. But at the end of the day, I come for a good career mode. These newer titles are more flash than substance in that regard. For a AAA title, not a bad price, especially if you're a fan of the sport.

I simply do not enjoy the game-play this year. I really liked pes 2018 and 2019. I didn't play 2020 so I thought I'd pick up this one again since it was less than half of the normal price with the sale. 

CONS:
-The movement and everything the players do is so clunky compared to how it used to be. 
-Professional world class players somehow can't take a good first touch
-No one can run with the ball. I you even sprint for a second you get shoved off the ball
-The interceptions are so unpredictable (The "derp mode" when everyone is fumbling for the ball is far worse than ever.)
-Free kicks are WAY TOO EASY TO SCORE. If you foul anywhere within 35YDs it's almost a guaranteed goal.
-Strength is OP. Pick tall, high strength players and be prepared to win every single tackle easily. 
-There are game-breaking exploits like being able to BLOCK THE GK IN CO-OP on free kicks. 
-You still can't add filters to matchmaking i.e. Co-op against other co-op teams, not a player with AI team mates. Or play against others using manual controls only. Also you can't just play against real teams. It's always against myClub teams.
-The friends list system and match room stuff is soooo bad. No integration for steam friends list or anything. Want to play co-op? Ok go browse servers and do all this other bs. Just a huge lack of online features. Want to play a random selection match with a friend online? Too bad, local matches only. 
-They give way too much away on myClub. Very few players should have a full black ball team the first week of release if any at all. They make it too easy to get the best players. Why is it that EVERY OPPONENT HAS ALL THE ICONS AND FULL BLACK BALL BENCH?? It would be better to be forced to play with an ok team that is 3-star rated maybe a gold or two. Nope, it's white ball team then straight to black ball right away. This makes it so unrewarding. 
-Player switching mechanics are worse. Like the ball will move through a player right by the ball and it won't let you switch. Changing to manual or whatever did not help.
-Every player online just pings it up top and 1-2 passes thru ball and that's it. That's because it is the only style in this version that gets rewarded.
-You can score off kickoff by sending your passer on a run after kickoff then just long thru and it works 50% of the time because of horrible marking AI on def.
-Still uses peer-to-peer connection, no dedicated matchmaking servers which leads to shit connection and lag.
-Huge amount of cheaters in the game. I come up against myClub teams with the ENTIRE TEAM RATED 109 which is impossible. It would come out to 99 in every stat and there is a training level limit that prevents this so WTF. 
-Nothing else other than what is mentioned above has changed from the older versions. So essentially the gameplay has gone way downhill. Graphics, data packs, and whatnot is pretty much the same as it has been. 

PROS:
-The non-online multiplayer modes are fantastic. I love the be a pro and master league. very fun. 
-The difficulty level on the AI is very challenging as well. Legend mode is actually hard. Scoring against the legend AI is extremely rewarding. 
-There is a great modding community that carries this game every release.

UPDATE: Even in the sanctioned eFootball league matchmaking modes, there are still cheaters. I am up 3-0 in the 90th minute and the opponent unplugs their ethernet and the game disconnects. Says match cancelled due to unforseen circumstances. I do not get a win despite clearly having won the game. They don't get a loss. It is complete bull. This is the competitive "esports" mode and this is extremely common. And you can't even report them afaik. Online just really sucks

This is a singleplayer gamemode review.

This is the same old game from 2010. They only make the players clumsier.

Scripted results, bad AI players, insane amount of weird fouls, buttons that are pointless (you cant score from a cross, unless you press 2 buttons for that cross. wow!), boring matches due to weird contact detection and not a single foul from the PC, and the same old shit from every single release, all in a specially clumsy experience were your players act like they never ever played football before. They only seem to make an effort in actually avoiding the ball like its made of lava somehow.

The same immensely annoying drawback of this game (it's been going on for 10+ years) is back again. When this game is good is great but then there is the "difficulty" levels. Faster pressure from defenders, quicker reaction times from attackers, fast paced passing and beautifully constructed plays is what I expect from higher difficulty settings. PES (eFootball) difficulty is difficult because the opposition can kick you all game long and it's fine, they can dive at your legs, take your legs out, not touch the ball and it's fine, they can tackle you-NFL middle linebacker tackle-tackle you and it's fine. You try to steal the ball, shoulder to shoulder, foul. It's nonsense. 
You are already raging a bit and then it comes the passing. You are ready to put a through pass between two defenders, there is a player hitting the perfect line to get your through pass, your controller stick is obviously pointing to the opposition goal (because that is where you want to pass), you press the through pass button and your player PASSES THE BALL TO WHATEVER GUY IS BEHIND YOU!!!
I really hoped this stuff would not happen in this version but I guess it's ingrained in the game.
Mind you, I played Master League and this kept happening, can't imagine how much I would lose it if it happened against real players.
This is the last "PES" I buy as it is obvious they are never going to change that dumb difficulty gimmick.

This game is good for kids & teenagers who play online. For Adults who want a football simulator or want to play multiple  seasons of Master League, this is not recommended.

The game has unrealistic spacing, the players are too far apart, thus bypassing midfield play. 

Every player in the game can do a perfect running tackle without fouling, which makes players like N'Golo Kante less valuable. 

The A.I. seems over-coded there is too many scripts telling the A.I. where to be; (formation screen, attacking instructions, fluid formation, advanced instructions) all of these do the similar things, there is no need to have so many scripts, as a result the A.I. ignore the ball & players in dangerous positions.  

Every team plays the same way, regardless of tactics which makes Master League boring. They need to remove A.I. play sequences & make it a sandbox like Ps2 PES.

Konami need to remove a lot of needless script. They need to include sliders to adjust spacing & player ability like in FIFA. & we need an option to completely disable advanced instructions for all teams. 

Offline players make no profit for Konami so I doubt these changes will come.

Don't play this for the online modes if you don't know about them yet. I don't recommend playing online since normal matchmaking always takes forever and myClub mode is essentially Pay-to-Play. You almost always get matched up with teams whose players are far above yours and the match is just a waste of time by then. The only thing worth playing is probably the eFootball modes where you can play using original teams. That is, if you can find a match faster than the actual match is going to be.

Regarding offline modes, this is virtually the same game as the 2020 version, and KONAMI clearly were making it that way. It's not a problem imo, gameplay from the 2020 is still pretty good and feels realistic. But the only downside i think is the difficulty scaling. You can play at Top Player difficulty and almost every match you won't get a shot at all against your team, but the moment you play it on Super Star (or Legend), even players with 30 ratings below your players can dribble, pass, and shoot like they're all Messi or Ronaldo, not to mention every pass or shooting you make will be get intercepted or blocked most of the time.

But regardless, PES still has the best gameplay of any football sim, that includes the additional modes like Master League, Cups, Become a Legend, etc. But that's it, most of this game's strengths revolve around the offline modes.

[h1]PES21 Review with REALISM Mods - UPDATED REVIEW[/h1] 
[hr][b]Realism Mods[/b][/hr]: Who experiences PES21 with all the realism mods sees the game differently. Now I can say that I would never play it again without 150GB of mods. Some of the main things the mods add: better graphics, even details like dirt and tight kits, real kits, balls, boots. Lots of licenses, custom real stadiums, better lighting, turfs, fog.  New animations, intro scenes, fans chants, anthems, more managers, full cameras' customization. It's a whole different game. I can't stress that enough. If you enjoy the gameplay a little bit, please go after Mods. Some hours of installations and whatever will pay off. 
(Check KnightMDs' YouTube video at the end of the review)
[h1]Comparing the base game with FIFA [/h1]
[hr][b]Gameplay[/b][/hr]: feels more natural, some dumb and funny moments occur, players seem more ''human'' and less ''gods'' in comparison to FIFA. 
[hr][b]offline[/b][/hr]: both lack depth offline. PES' Master Leagues are fun and remind you of the past, but FIFA now has more customization and content, more stuff to do out of the matches. However, in PES it feels like your formations and strategies matter more, and this is rewarding. In FIFA just buy fast paced players and you're good to go.
[hr][b]online[/b][/hr]: both have problems (like scripting that interferes in matches) and repetitive player cards, but FIFA looks more stable (servers) and has many more players. Also, FIFA's FUT has a big market behind it, so at least you don't feel like you are playing a dead game.
[hr][b]Graphics[/b][/hr]: PES without mods is kinda trash to be honest. Now that I use around 150GB of mods, I can clearly say that FIFA has better visuals, although animations are somewhat unnatural. A nice thing about PES is that if you watch it without Interface and from a Broadcast camera, it looks closer to a real life match.
[hr][b]Licenses[/b][/hr]: In PES: get Mods!!! In FIFA you already have 99% of licensed content from the get go, which is good.
[hr][b]Soundtrack[/b][/hr]: IDK if it's relevant... anyways... the soundtrack is meh. PES should get more and better songs. FIFA games have always had better soundtracks.
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]  
Get PES if you are looking to enjoy offline fun gameplay and willing to spend some hours installing Mods. If you get the full pack of realistic mods,  you will probably enjoy it!!!
Get FIFA if you demand a more polished game from the get go (menus, intros, licenses and graphics), or if you only play online, because it's more established.
[hr] [/hr]
[i]Just my opinion. You can check the demo for gameplay and the video below for modded graphics.[/i]
KnightMD's  realism review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YDC7wi87_YA
Check Jeremiah Osoba's lighting/fog/turfs incredible mods: https://www.flickr.com/photos/188920274@N06/ / https://www.patreon.com/user?u=35138442

Friendship with FIFA ended, PES is my best friend now. 

Ive been playing My Club (basically ultimate team) mostly and i love it. Its easier to build up your team, you can level up your players, and its not as big of a grind to get yourself a nice amount of coins (plus you can sim matches thatll play on their own if thats your jam). PES is way more relaxed and doesnt seem as money hungry/greedy as EA. I understand licencing is a big turn-off for some, but on PC it is incredibly easy to upload kits, teams, players and leagues into the game. It only took me about 10 minutes to add the Australian A League, MLS, Spanish 3rd tier, and Englands League 1 and 2. Be a Pro feels a bit clunky and i would like to see more in that part of the game but apart from that, im happy!

A potentially great game ruined by poor AI in the master league. The AI advantage for your computer opponent is ridiculous. It disappears at any level in free play friendlies, but as others have mentioned here your teammates turn into lobotomy victims and your opponents could all play for Madrid. You can outshoot the computer 10-1 and still lose regularly. Ruinously stupid "catch up" AI, completely unnecessary as evidenced by the balanced friendlies against the same computer opponent.

On top of that you have the usual panoply of Konami incompetence: no tournament option, a 'quit' button hidden in the options menu, a league that forces you to roleplay as manager whether you want to or not and subjects you to endlessly annoying cutscenes and press conferences. These should all be options, not forced on the player, just as there should be easy menus for league, career, tournament etc.

So the game is fine, but you must be online to play the game. Shortcuts from previous versions like "port 0" doesn't work anymore. So if your wifi is down, you can't play the game at all. And that's always a "thumbs down" with me. It's not really MY game, if a dev, an internet provider or a weather event like a storm or blizzard or else decides if I can play the game (against AI) I bought with my money.

It's fun when it works. When it doesn't -- your AI players play against you (they don't make runs and are generally useless in defense, often providing a clear shot for the attacking forwards by literally moving *away* from the ball, instead of toward it). Switching system is broken -- it switches to the player that doesn't make sense in a current situation, then when you switch from player to player, there's a slight stopping of movement which kills any attempt at defending properly and causes players to be "pulled back by poltergeist. I mostly play the online co-op with real players (playing w/ the AI is torture as noted above) -- that could be fun when the teams are evenly matched, often times I am playing against much better teams (which is fine) and/or my team is nerfed and players are slower than usual (which is what makes it a bad experience); sometimes kicking the ball takes longer than it should which makes it hard to do quick plays, that's particularly costly in front of your own goal where forwards can just spam a button and easily take the ball. Menu needs to be simplified -- there are too many leagues and it's unclear what league/tournament impacts what rank. In 2021, "clan" is probably not the best word to use multiple times to describe teaming up with people. Servers don't work on Thursday in the US which means you can't really play then if all you do is play online. I should mention I mostly play co-op because I can never find an opponent in "ranked match," not sure if that's true for a lot of people. The last time I tried ranked match I was getting people w/ a much higher rank which makes the games pointless. I've had some great times with this game, but I can't recommend it in its current state. Hard to *not* uninstall it after you see your players' lack of interest. It's like playing against the wind.

Played PES '08 till '10ish and then Fifa '11 to '18ish and back to PES 20 and now.
Is it better than Fifa? In some ways, When Attacking, Yes. But defending? There's lots of improvements needed.
-Switching Cursors: (Out of possession) Makes me switch to players that is farther from the ball when there is literally people who are closer to/ in front of the ball who have bigger chance of snatching the ball. Even when using the RS still doesn't help.
- The Jockeys stance when defending is a joke.
- (Sometimes) When one of the CB is out of position, the other CB that should've stayed in the center and cover also ran out of position covering LB/RB. WHY?
- Slightest turn when chasing the ball sometimes makes the player stops as if turning 90 degrees.
Fix those if you want to be crowned as the football sim again. No wonder Fifa have been butchering Pes in a decade.

There are lots of good things to say:
- Shooting feels good, with a satisfying thunk when the ball hits the back of the net
- Defensive play is good
- Close control dribbling is good, although receiving seems a little random sometimes

Overall, I'm giving this a thumbs down for a few reasons:
- MyClub mode:
- This should be the area of most focus now for online gaming, but lots of issues with matchmaking
- Takes ages to try and get online games, sometimes in certain categories it just times out. Maybe there are no players for the category, but why waste your time "searching". Often when there are players to match with it first cycles through trying to find players very close to you, and within your skill rating. Again this is just time consuming as you wait for it to eventually tell you that the connection quality is only medium and asking if you want to proceed anyway.
- Overall, this has led to  me spending more time waiting for games than actually playing them 
- Lastly, the "Iconic Moments" is just ridiculous, no idea what the % chances of getting some of the players are but I spent €30 on coins and spent it all on the recent AC Milan pack. Not one of the 3 classic players for this is crazy. It's not really possible to get these packs and players without spending a large amount of additional money as the gold coin rewards in-game are few and far between, most rewards just being GP.

The only game mode of PES I player is Master League, so your mileage may vary. I skipped a few editions and upgraded to PES 2021 from PES 2018. My initial impressions were good - the UI design was slicker and the graphics and player animations were much improved.

However, it did not take long to see that all of the old failings of Master League were still here. Scripted goals are still a thing, where AI players miraculously dance through your defence, with successful tackles doing little more than delaying the inevitable for a few seconds at best. Player statistics seem to be completely irrelevant - your quickest players will never outrun the AI's slowest and your powerhouse centre forward will stumble to the ground at the merest hint of contact from an AI defender. The AI's flawless timing on tackles means that it is almost impossible to dribble past a defender.

These things are annoying, but not fatal, and have been present in Master League for a long time. What has changed in the 2021 edition is a marked increase in another of Master League's age old flaws: increasing the difficulty of games by making your team play worse. Much worse. Cup games, derbies etc. can be almost unplayable with pass assist practically working against you and your world class players suddenly shambling halfwits unable to control the simplest of passes. This focus on making your team play worse rather than having the AI play better can make these games impossible to enjoy. And in 2021 this happens far, far more than in previous iterations and is much more noticeable.

Compared to the gameplay issues it's an extremely minor point, but manager avatars in 2021 Master League are truly bizarre. In previous versions there was rudimentary character customisation so you could make a manager that had a passing resemblance to you. That is gone in 2021 and now, instead, you choose from a list of about 12 predefined manager models based on real life managers. So unless you look like Roberto Carlos (yes, apparently) or Steven Gerrard you're out of luck.

It's hard to describe how disappointing PES 2021's Master League is. Where 2018 was an obviously flawed, but still mostly enjoyable affair 2021 is a frustrating slog with occasional moments of brilliance.

I have been playing FIFA on and off for about 10 years now, while being a hardcore PES/WE/ISS player prior.

GOOD
- An incredible yet fun simulation of the beautiful game
- Master League is so much fun
- Much nicer looker player models than FIFA
- Designed for customization (so importing the missing licenses/kits/faces is literally 5 mins of work)
- Quite affordable for hours of gameplay

BAD
- Sub-par commentary
- The user interface could be prettier and easier to use

UGLY
- Not for people looking for a quick and easy football experience
- Every year the same game

CONCLUSION
I recommend this game wholeheartedly. There is also a free lite version if you have any doubts.

TLDR: Not quite there yet. Good game to play with friends and casually. Not recommended for people who get frustrated at imperfections.

NOTICE: I only played offline in Master League. First at "Professional" now at "Top Player"

I had fun in the beginning when I was playing a lower tier club (Leeds United) and trying to get it on a higher level. Now around 50 hours I can't ignore my frustrations anymore when playing Chelsea with a squad of high rated players.

When you select a player sometimes for whatever reason they stop running for a second and face the opposite direction than the one they were previously facing. Resulting in too many scenarios where opponent just gets past your defender and your defender looks like some clueless person who never played fotball in their life.

Retarded judge AI doesn't have common sense in estimating obvious scenarios. Many times when there's offside I need to wait for the player to touch the ball in order for the referee to stop the play. This wastes everyone stamina and time. Players do this too when they mindlessly run at a ball they can never ever catch, but this one you can stop with RB + RT.

There are fouls which aren't fouls at all. A player goes to shoot a ball, opponent puts leg forward into shooters legs, gets hit and it's a foul.

Players looking at a ball going past them like they see it for the first time in their life.

In my opinion they are attempting to make a realistic football game but it's just not there yet. You have to constantly compensate and find compromises. Both between opponent difficulty (because increasing difficulty somehow increases abilities of low level players on abnormal levels) and level of control (assisted vs non assisted).

I'll still play this game from time to time and I do recommend it for those who want to have fun with their friends but I don't recommend it if you think these small details will annoy you.

Releasing a yearly update with the new teams, players and a few graphical changes has been a request from many yearly football sim players for what seems like forever, with many claiming the usual releases are little more than that anyway. So, while it works on a true next-gen version of PES for next year that’s exactly what we get here.

You’ve got updated squads, new kits for the small selection of licensed clubs, a smattering a new boots and some updated player and manager faces. There’s also the very limited Euro 2020 mode that launched as free DLC for PES 2020 and some minor gameplay tweaks that actually make this a better game of football than its predecessor. For the £25 asking price, and especially if you didn’t pick up PES 2020, this is a surprisingly good deal.

Even if, like me, you’re a die-hard FIFA fan, I doubt you could say with a straight face that EA’s offering gives a better semblance of the beautiful game than PES. It just simply doesn’t. PES is the king when it comes to gameplay, with a far more realistic and rewarding game that doesn’t feel like a number of canned animations sewn together. Your decisions make a difference in PES 2021 and there’s a feeling of satisfaction when you join multiple passes together and see the ball fly into the top corner that is absent elsewhere.

If you played PES 2020 then the gameplay is 99% the same here. The ball physics remain excellent and the slightly slower speed at which matches happen not only feels more realistic, but it lets you actually create nice build-up tactics rather than just bombing down the wing with Jadon Sancho. The general animations are excellent and every touch, knick from a defender or shot just about feels unique.

If you played hours upon hours of PES 2020 you’ll likely notice some of the small gameplay improvements. Movement feels a bit more fluid, passes and through balls seem to feel better and I still love being able to manually move players off the ball. All in all it’s mostly a pleasure to play whether you’re on the attack or hunkering down at the back.

Whereas in FIFA defending can be infuriating, here it’s far more a case of being patient and timing things correctly. The first few games I was conceding numerous goals, but after some practice and relearning the nuances of PES I was back to controlling the game.

A big downside with this Season Update mantra is that gameplay issues from PES 2020 haven’t been fixed. My biggest issue is the AI of the players, which all too often leaves them wandering randomly around or not moving towards the ball until it lands at their colourful Nike boot. I found myself having to wait for the ball to arrive before I could do anything meaningful. These bouts feel much more obvious when the majority of the gameplay feels very real.

Overall At This Price Cost i think its worth

1) They use the same menus that feel like you're in the 80's. 10 clicks to do even the most basic things. They simply disregard any investment in usability and UI. Bad translations. No proper instructions around how to play the game, just couple mambo jumbo sentences that doesn't really help anyone learn how to play the game, how to aim a header, how to avoid many of the odd situations that seems like comedy in gameplay. 
2) The player rating system is the same as 20 years ago, the attributes doesn't change the gameplay at all. Licences are terrible, you can't find not even 20% of the teams that actually matter. Every roster is NEVER, i repeat, NEVER in sync up with reality. Clearly there is zero research on what's current going on, feels like they watch the news once every few months to see who is the player with more marketing and then boosts that one. All teams except the ones that are sponsoring the game are shitty, specially from less-known centers.
3) It is completely ridiculous how they favour Bayern, Barcelona and the few teams that gives money to Konami to promote themselves. Only these teams get good stats in their players. It also influences match results.
4) Online experience is the worst ever. Matchmaking doesn't work, location limiting all the place, you can never exactly know how big the ping is as it constantly suggest people from the other side of the world to play with you. Also, there is no ranking system. Throws you into almost all matches with >200 ping regardless of where you're playing from (i tried it from 3 different countries with same bad experience). They pretend to have some ranking system in place but there isn't, it's all just just some japanese-like nonsense numbers that grow when you win and shrink when you lose, but that is not related to anything else. When you just start your team with crap players they put you against people with All star teams with all 100 rating players and you get constantly crushed.
5) Infinite number of bugs and comedy situations in the gameplay. It has nothing to do with how real football works. Very strong and irrational catch-up logic where, if you're winning a game, it forces you to make dumb mistakes in defence in order to give your opponent the chance to turn around and beat you. There is no logic on how the referee works, fouls and everything feels like a different sport entirely.

I could keep writing how bad this game is, but in summary Konami will never get my time or money again. I will start playing FIFA now.

This game is a mess the higher you go in difficulty in offline modes. Specifically, if you play cup games on Superstar, the games are a roll of the dice in how much your team will be handicapped and the COM cheats. That is, your own players will lack positional awareness, often running into each other and if they do make runs, do so in a way that will make it easier for the com to steal the ball. For example, if they are open, they'll run toward the defender, run backwards, or start their run forward and then stop when you pass to them. On the other hand, none of these handicaps affect the COM, who have players making perfect runs and react instantaneously when defending.

To make matters worse, if the COM decides to start the game on red - attack minded, that adds an extra layer of handicap in that they are able to press you as a team, attack with everyone moving forward, and defend with everyone running backwards with no detriment to their stamina for the entire game. This results in your players being unable to string along competent passes: passes get intercepted because your players delete their own space, through balls no matter the strength will overshoot, passes may hit the heels of your players, etc.. while this rarely if ever, impacts the COM. 

In summary, you can begin to recognize moments when you are in for some absurd "dynamic difficulty" momentum bull shit that ruin the game. You don't lose fairly, you lose unfairly that makes you feel like you have been cheated and had no control in your game.

What Pes2020 should have been. This game is amazing, the gameplay is fluid and organic, player collide, ball physics is realistic and player animations are the best yet. The pacing of the game is practically perfect, not slow but not arcady eiher. the issue of unlicenced teams can be quickly fixed by using option files available online which provide all the kits, emblems and team names required. Master League remains my go-to game mode as it has provided me with endless hours of both playing football as well as experiencing the challenge of building a team from the ground up, tailored to your playstyle. This year especially, with its reduced price, I think its a no brainer of a purchase. Yes, the game is practically the same as last year, however they have fixed most of the issues and improved the football side of the game so much. Looking forward to what the new engine will have to offer next year! But for now I am satisfied with this years season update.

This review is more of a meh review rather than positive. The last PES I played was 2018 and I played a little over 100 hours. That game had a lot of issues. I tend to focus more on the Master League because I like the management aspect of it. Sadly, all the problems that game had are back here and some are even worse. 9 out of 10 times when the ref calls a foul it's for the opposing team. Speaking more broadly, there are a lot of oddities when playing. The goalie will just stand there sometimes and not do anything when you shoot. Opposing players can just straight up tackle you and it's not a foul. Overall, gameplay is alright. Definitely not great. The UI also got revamped from what I've seen but I think it's worse now. A lot of things are buried deep  where they shouldn't necessarily be. I may be wrong, but there was no way for me to see what my team's star ranking was in Master League. One of the best things about Master League is seeing how your team progresses and changes over time and the star ranking is an ok reflection of that. Except I couldn't fucking find it. I won't complain about the licenses, fake names and lack of stadiums even though I should. Those can be fixed if you download a file. I also won't complain about the online because I haven't played.
In conclusion, this game is a little above meh. It's definitely not great, but the gameplay can still be very fun most of the time.
