PES actually does provide a better footballing experience than FIFA, but it is far from perfect.

My main point of focus with football games has always been single player Career Mode, so everything I reference here relates to that specifically.

The main issues I have experienced (All ASSISTS Turned off + Max Difficulty:Legendary) is that the animations are janky.  

They are simply not smooth enough, 360 degrees of angle are not available and switching direction is a very digital sharp experience; the ball physics are not realistic enough either (stops too soon - like playing in mud);  The replays & cutscenes are equally frustrating when they stop and hang for 2-3 seconds before the game starts again.

Some of the AI player movement however is very good (In terms of football flow), attacking and passing from the AI can be very authentic at times allowing for quick decisive football to be played ; making for some for good exciting footballing moments.

When passing yourself though (without assists turned on) can take too long to initiate a simple short side-pass (causing you to get tackled when you shouldn't) & due to the limited degrees of animation available the passing angles are also limited and the weight of a pass is inconsistent.

An example : there is a throughball button...why?  If I can accurately control the power and direction I put into a pass I can make my own throughball...so it stands to reason that the game is in part calculating who you want to pass to & frequently getting it wrong.

Now the AI are certainly NOT perfect either; there are many situations where an AI player will just turn in circles rather than cross, pass or try and take the ball past a defender.

The commentary is another area that needs work; the comments often do NOT accurately reflect what is happening on the screen and the number of comments available are so limited you get repetition many, many times even in a single match.

I do like and appreciate how I WILL Be substituted off if I am playing badly or lacking fitness, something I rarely if ever see in FIFA.

As a final thought:  I have played FIFA and PES for many years and the most recent feature that made me choose FIFA over PES was tackling.  The addition of a button to actually stick your foot out and tackle a player (or intercept a pass) made FIFA feel more realistic (not the case anymore due to many issues) but the one thing I can barely stand is pressing and holding a single button to tackle, it is horrible and completely unrealistic and has not been improved for more than 30 years!  Time to think about doing this the right way PES!

PLEASE STOP trying to copy FIFA!  If PES can bring us a realistic feeling footy game you will put a nice dent in FIFA, if you just copy FIFA's FUT you're just going to be a poor imitation.

(I haven't seen VAR either yet?)

Worse than Fifa21 in almost every category.

CONS
Gameplay:
- the obnoxious scripting where suddenly AI turns into Super Saiyan's is a game-breaker.
- motion is so sluggish that it feels like the players are running in mud
- dribbling is near impossible unless you're a "pro" at this game, problem is defenders auto-tackle so accurately and at times from way out of a realistic range.
- tackling/fouls is yet another game-breaker, so many slight knocks that lead to yellow and red cards is unbelievable in this game.

Graphics:
- "PES has better graphics" - no it really doesn't, the kits look like clay melted onto the players' bodies. Or you could say that players look like they're wearing 20 layers of clothing. Look at FIFA21 and how the kits literally move/stretch when they're in motion.
- "grass is better in PES" no not really, the green is so over-saturated it begins to look like an animation rather than real life, hence the million grass mods available.
- Konami has made maybe 1000 "REAL" faces in this game, and have given 25,000+ players clone faces that look so awful you have to remind yourself you're not stuck in 2010. Seriously, how does Marco Reus not have a real face????????
- Just about every face "mod" is stolen from past FIFA games, which just goes to who there who is better in that category.
- As usual, Konami is too lackluster to purchase the licence for more teams, so once again players are forced to mod kits into their games, some people even having to pay (PESUNIVERSE).
- Master League is so lackluster, just, Konami have a gander at FIFA21/20/19/18/17/16/15/14/13 and maybe actually try to do better? better at least compared to FIFA13 career mode ?????

UI/Sound/misc:
- Sound is actually not too bad, but then again how hard is it to implement recordings.
- the UI is actually rubbish, Konami aren't hiding the fact that they are dwarfed by EA's budget.
- the amount of god-damn pop-ups when you enter the game, NO I'M NOT INTERESTED IN YOUR PROMOTIONAL/ONLINE CRAP :S

The gameplay has accelerated, the dribbling ability has meant and the entertainment rate has really increased. 2020 may be the same including interfaces but bugs etc. The little twist on their gameplay relative to the price has been successful if we don't take things into account. I am looking forward to the PES 2022 and the Unreal Engine 5 engine. If they make a light and fun-oriented game instead of a heavy game like 2020, that's when the competition with FIFA starts. People are looking for fun in games, of course, realism will be, but due to the extremely slow gameplay of 2020, it was becoming unbearable after a certain period of time. It is the same game but the price is really affordable, and it is great that they give 3000 coins worth 30 dollars and 1 free icon player.Yes it's worth the price:

Pros:
- cheaper than Fifa
- improvement on the UI (i like the simple menu)
- so far so good (no lag, no annoying bug)

Cons:
- license always the license.
(for me the cons is only the license)

You take the form of an omnipresent parasite capable of manipulating up to 'about' eleven people - but only one at a time - kind of like Agent Smith from The Matrix and I say 'about' eleven because sometimes you control the goalkeeper. I assume they have an invisible high mental defence stat and often will only follow basic one button commands at certain moments in the game, i.e. penalties, free kicks and when you get desperate you make them hunt the ball down like a homing missile. Each mouth breathing husk has the illusion of free will in the form of statistics and a game to game buff, utter indifference or debuff called conditioning, which vaguely give the impression of individuality. This is assisted also by the strategy menu in which you can place minions in a way you deem aesthetically pleasing. The playable characters seem to behave autonomously while you are mentally manipulating one of your victims, but only the creature you control is capable of making a real difference; kicking, pretending not to kick (in a variety of ways) and scoring goals. You must score at least one more than the opposition to achieve a win scenario.

During a match there is one uncontrollable character known as a referee whose appearance shape shifts but their statistics seem to stay the same. They have a whistle and can point. If a player tries to take the ball inappropriately, of which the definition isn't clear or explained in game, they will often unveil a card of either yellow or red but usually sequentially from yellow to red. Interestingly they will rarely show these cards to the AI parasite. I found them to be far too influential on a match and gave the AI a lot of opportunities to score. The referee also has two companions who communicate in semaphore, and they're infallible in their decision-making.

There are several scenarios to overcome and a vast amount of nebulous clubs to choose from each of varying colours and stats. I can't speak for the majority of them as I have exclusively only played as Japan in the Asia-Oceania Cup on the superstar difficulty level. At the time of writing this review (41.5 hours...) I finally won it, which fair enough, might say more about me than the game. My vacuous marionettes unstrung themselves and celebrated as if they had achieved this trophy on their own merit. Unaware of the brain pilfering abomination in their midst and its vain and insatiable lust for silverware.

Tl;dr - This game is a parody of the real world game of football/soccer. A good one too and often very funny.

I really can't see a way to describe this on a game store without comparing it with FIFA (which is a shame if you ask me). Of course we can give it to FIFA when it comes to licences and content, there's no debate there. But do you want to really enjoy the mechanics closer to a sport simulator or not? As a plus, the online mode is really giving you the opportunity have an "Ultimate Team" without those bucks EA pushes for. Take it for a spin, even the lite version lets you play vs the PC in myClub.

Gameplay is tougher in comparison to PES 2020, even average European teams are very hard to beat especially in away games as the AI automatically has them moving faster and winning almost every physical challenge. This takes most of the fun away. The game doesn't run silky smooth even after every graphics card update and lags on systems above the recommended specs. Considering the reasonable amount Konami charged for it it is not a bad purchase but not a great deal either. It basically comes down to a habit with the PES series : If you're a football fan and your team is featured in the current iteration, you want to see how well they fare in a simulated environment. This is as much of a reason to buy a football simulation as is enjoying the game itself. I haven't played FIFA since the '94 edition so can't compare them but just speaking for the PES series, yes, it is a convincing and satisfying simulation experience no matter what its rival does. So all in all, this is still a good purchase in 2021.

After playing Fifa for 3-4 years I went back to PES with 2020. And 2021 is simpel the same game that's why it is cheap.
PES is a real football/Soccer simulation.
If you guys are looking for a very competitive environment with an arcade style soccer game, chose FIFA.
If you guys are looking for soccer/football simulation with much mature environment, choose PES, it is that simple.

The scripting is horrid. You will NOT get the ball unless the AI deems it okay. The AI are never off balance the way you will be off balance when tackled so they easily take the ball right back or the ball conveniently falls into the legs of the nearest AI player. Even if you send in more players to mark.

Harmless standing tackles are too often reffed as fouls and your players fail to challenge for obvious interceptions or passes to them. Sliding tackles are guaranteed yellow cards. The AI standing tackles are 100% precise every single time no matter what team it is or player involved. AI often hilariously takes the ball under your players foot as the shoot animation takes place and if your foot touches theirs during the shooting animation it is an immediate foul in favour of the AI. 22 hours into the game and a referee has never called a foul in favour of my players so I often end up with upwards of 7 fouls per game to the AIs 0. 

Any set piece the AI gets will result in a shot on goal - doesn't matter from how far back. If its anywhere near the box its a goal as long as the AI is shooting it. The passing is over hyped by Konami. Pass weight is disgustingly inconsistent and pass direction is forever on its own mission. The through ball is broken in this game and your players tend to dawdle instead of running forward to receive the ball - often only choosing to run when it will be an obvious offside or when the rest of the AI team has caught up. Creative passes to an open player that could lead to a goal are punished and not rewarded, as the receiving player is nudged off course without a pushing animation by the AI or slowed down to a crawl without a justifiable animation/ reason when AI players are nearby. 

For all the hype that has been made about how ''fantastic'' and ''realistic'' the passing is, I find it laughable how making a pass ''off balance'' leads to the lousiest pass you'll ever see and yet the AI itself routinely gets away with extremely accurate passes under high pressure situations with ease. Having a fast player like a Sane, Dembele or Mbape means nothing in this game because even with a 10 meter head start the AI will catch that player and guide him off the ball with ease. Easy headers or passes are foiled when the ball goes right through your receiving player and into the possession of the player BEHIND you.

The big 5 star teams are easiest to beat and the ones where the player with the highest overall is 70 are the hardest to beat because of broken scripting. None of the goals the AI score ever feel deserved because of the scripting that allows them to get the ball in the first place. The commentary is extremely dated, some player names aren't even included so the commentary goes silent and the interface looks similar and equal to or worse than PES 2011 (The previous PES game I had). Frustrating experience doesn't cover it. Just buy FIFA.

This was my first football game since Fifa 16 on Xbox 360. For some reason I assumed we had moved forwards since that game came out, but to be honest that game is **a lot** more fun to play than this. This game is full of inexplicable bugs.
- Players missing obvious interception opportunities even when the ball rolls quietly past 1m ahead of them
- My players rushing and crashing into my own goalie or even saving the ball 0.5m before my goalie would've had it (and no way to stop them from doing this)
- Players constantly running into eachother and falling
- Referee gives out fouls and yellows constantly for no reason, ignores others
- Referee takes really long to stop the game in case of offside, causing you to sprint 100m towards the goal first
- The AI takes a really long time to take corners, they just stand there for a while delaying the game
- There are replays of every little semi-interesting situation, and you have to press start (not A) on the controller to skip them (although you skip everything else with A) which makes for a really frustrating experience
- The ingame menus are difficult to navigate (go to Settings to shut down the game???)

All in all I can only wholeheartedly recommend anyone looking for a fun football game to go back and play Fifa 16 or similar, which is a much more fun game than this.

As the title suggests, it is similar to the 2020 edition but with various updates for the current season. Apparently they will release a 'full' title for 2022. I wish companies would do this kind of thing more often.

It's better than the 2020 edition, despite only being a season update. It feels better to play both online and offline. The UI is better. Overall an improvement on 2020, which wasn't that great. It's quite fun and there are plenty of tactical options, but they keep them simple so anyone can play around with them.

Most people pick big teams online, but I like to pick 'lesser teams' as it makes things more interesting for me. 

One last thing, for the official names, extra faces, full kits etc etc please check out SmokePatch (google it). Those guys have been doing this for years are for me are the best. Comes with easy installer and easy way to 'switch off' the patch so you can play online.

I haven't played many hours, but I know I will play a lot more over the next few months as it feels pretty solid and a good deal for the price.

PESXXXX (insert any number here). Same (badly) scripted football-like game as ever where you control one player (two if you know how to partially control a second one) vs 11 enemy players + ref. Outraging random refereeing where two-feet hack from behind can be just a lecture, but any contact harder than a kiss on a cheek is ALWAYS a foul (vs COM) and a most likely a yellow. Don't get me wrong, I play since PES5 and know how to win, but literally nothing changed since first post-PES6 release (what it was? PES 2007? 2008? who cares).
You can get it more or less enjoyable with advanced/manual finishing and passing. but it's not easy to master and I bet 99% of new players will ragequit rather sooner than later.
Still, I don't "recommend" the game 'cause it's pointless to recommend the only game on the market. No, football games where you CAN'T SAVE A GODDAMN REPLAY doesn't count. At all. You can buy it, especially considering a "special" price, but don't expect a "football simulator". It's more like "football storyteller" where most of the stuff on the pitch is decided for you (unless you go full manual controls). Considering that, "Become A Legend", where you control only one player, is a most balanced mode.
Another annoying thing about PES is how fast they update rosters. As of November, 6, line-up of Juventus, one of the title teams, is still fundamentally wrong. Didn't checked other teams, but I bet it's the same. You should learn from Sports Interactive, Konami guys.

UPDATE: DataPack 3.0 is out, Juventus lineup is still heavily wrong. This is anything but "SEASON UPDATE".

This is the first time ever I'm writing a review, and it's sad that this is the game that forces me to so. 
I like to play Master League, so I don't have an opinion about online, never cared to play online. This game has some serious in game issues about balance. It's unfair to the player (you), even in Normal difficulty, don't get me even started in Legendary. In some matches your players play like zombies and in other matches fast as hell. Players are full rested in both cases. If the AI decides that it wants to score, there is nothing you can do to change that, even if you somehow manage to tackle the player, the ball will ALWAYS go to the opponent team. I beat Barcelon 3-0 with ease, some unknown team with 65 player ability on average will play like their life depends on the match, my players speed and acceleration is 90, AI with 65 is faster than me. If somehow I manage to take the ball from the opponent player, it will always be a foul, oppononent kills my player with a tackle? No foul. Don't get me wrong, I like to be challenged, but this is just unfair and frustrating.

Well, it is very hard for me to release a bad review after almost 240 hours of playing time. But in order to  be honest the game is a piece of crap. If you allow me a few minutes of your precious time, I will try to explain myself as accurate as possible. First, once the game decides that you are going to loose , there is nothing at all that you can do. YOU ARE GOING TO LOOSE. Your opponent will score and you will not. It does not matter your strategy, your players or whatever. You will loose, and that it is a fact. Second, if you are playing a mayor league the top teams will win almost all the games reaching an imposible score like 37 wins 1 draw which it is totally unreal. Third, your players won´t follow your commands. You may try to defend or to steal a ball or even anticipate a pass. Your players will be lazy, won´t follow your commands, and guess what, YOU WILL LOOSE. I´m almost a 50 years old guy and I have been playing video games since I can recall and this it is not ok. I don´t care if I loose, I´m use to it. As a matter of fact, I loose a lot, and I´m ok with it. But I want to loose when I deserve it, not when the game decides it. I belive a game should be a challenge but not a cheater and this game definitely it is. Please forgive me about my english as it is not my first language. I hope I´ve been able to express myself properly, and I wish you all great and enjoyable times with some other awesome games. Best of luck.

[b][h1]Review surrounds around coming from Fifa and transfered over to PES[/h1][/b]

Can be a struggle at first, but once you get the hang of things it's great! The support from the devs is that much better then that of Fifa... which I have played a while untill I got tired of all it's bugs in the singleplayer experience, missing features, broken dynamics. In PES you can be subbed on/off dependent on your performances on the pitch. On fifa you either start and go all the way out the game, regardless of your performance (or if you run out of all your stamina is the only way the manager on fifa will sub you off). Being subbed on isn't even a feature for Fifa become a pro player. Which is dissapointing as it is a football game. 

Though the game felt odd and slow paced at first, you'll more then likely come to enjoy it if you enjoy more realistic gameplay, and feel like actually becoming a pro while playing. Where as Fifa you just feel like doing things for no reason. Transfer market seems to work 2/10 times you request it. While here it works simutaniously, just ask that you wish to leave when the window is open, and you'll get transfers in that suits for your development. There is also an option to ask your agent to request a transfer to a specific club, which will make him talk to the respecitve manager at the club about a possibility of a transfer for you to the suggested club. 

Once more, you have an actual contract in PES, whilst Fifa, you don't at all. Get to a club, you're there infinitely till you get a transfer and decide to leave. Also salary don't increase at the same club you're at, it only changes after you switch clubs. But in PES, you've got a contract, and if you do well the same club can and will offer you a better contract with them. Contracts has certain amount of years/time, like in real life. 

[b][u]So to sum it up...[/u][/b]

If you are looking for a realistic football game to create your pro and feel like actually accomplishing things, struggeling to be fit and in form to keep your spot in the line-up. Then for sure this is the game for you. You may be put off that this don't have as many licenses as Fifa does, and hence you don't get that real realistic feeling and enjoyment... [spoiler]Well there are mods to implement the teams of your desire, and it isn't hard to do at all. [/spoiler]

_Review only about the offline modes_

Switching from FIFA, I've played PES 2020 and now the 2021 version. And yeah, like we all know it, it's pretty much the same game. Although I would say, players seem a tiny touch quicker in their reaction times and movements. And there's less of those moments where the player doesn't know what to do because they lost the ball. 

As I said in my review of the previous entry in the series, this is the game that made me fall in love with football again. It feels good in the build-up play, in defense as well, and super satisfying when you bang a screamer from outside the box. Playing PES gives me something very simple yet very important that FIFA failed to provide me these past few years: FUN. And for a casual player like me, this is key.

Both PES and FIFA are flawed game, you just gotta pick your poison. And for me PES for it's gameplay, is the winner. Yeah the lack of licensing is a drawback, but if you're on PC, it's not a difficult issue to solve. And I personally think about it as downloading the licensing to "enhance" the game even more rather than "fixing" it.

Anyway, to conclude this mess of a review, I highly recommand it if you are looking for some real football fun, and I can't wait to see what Konami has in store for us next year with the new Engine

So this is a "Season Update" since PES devs are busy making PES 2022 with Unreal Engine 5, which means this game is almost the same with PES 2020.
However, there are a couple of differences, and to be honest, they're not nice changes at all.

Unfortunately, the game has been dumbed down big time.
-Goalkeepers are almost useless, any player can score outside from the box like they're freakin' Batistuta, right in the corner. And top players like van Basten or Rummenigge can even score while they're under huge pressure.
-Also the passing system is a mess. Even while you are facing away from your teammate, you are able to pass the ball with almost 100% accuracy.
The online script can still break these obviously but you know the script interferes and affects many dynamics in the game and it's just another evil.

Anyway, gameplay-wise, these are the two biggest differences I've experienced so far compared to PES 2020.
For the rest, you can read my review about PES 2020 [url=steamcommunity.com/id/k1nJo/recommended/996470] here[/url] as they still apply to this day(except the super-cancel bug).

But since the game is cheaper, I'll give a thumb up only to support Konami for the sake of PES 2022, so I hope our support this year isn't for nothing and PES 2022 can rival FIFA in all aspects and not just gameplay.

Edit: Actually, I changed my mind. And I'm changing my review to negative cuz it is fkn aids.
-Defending in a football game by pressing 2 buttons shouldn't be praised. It is so bad that if you wanna defend manually it punishes you. It feels like there is no skill gap between players, maybe except top 1%, but for the rest, for 3 consecutive years now it's like I'm playing against the same guy. It is disgusting.
-Also, a football game with a dead dribbling system shouldn't be praised.
-And a game mode (matchday) which forces you to play against someone who's literally 11000 kilometers away shouldn't be praised as well.

This is a garbage game, stay away from it, at least from the online modes if you little care about your mental health.

Edit#2: Thanks for the award, kind stranger. And sorry that I forgot to thank this whole time.

I haven't played PES for a few years, but I heard the news RE: "season update" and that there are not much changes from 2020 etc... I suppose for someone like myself it was a great opportunity to pick up a new football (soccer :P) game for half the price. 

I'm loving the game; I don't tend to play ranked online much, I mostly run Master League and My Club (vs AI). Its a refreshing change of pace and realism compared to the other well known football game that just seems too Hollywood.

This football engine is a thing of beauty - some of the passages of play, still, after 70 hrs in is a joy to watch. I have a got a good raft of goals saved now and might do a montage :P

Licencing for clubs and uniforms is always a thorn in the side of Konami, but don't let that put you off, within 10 mins you can have all kits and logos.

One thing that does lack in this game is the commentary, it doesn't take long before you've heard every line and drone - this will hopefully be an area that will be addressed for the 2022 instalment. Also, I have to say, that online this game is completely different - it feels laggy and tends to be more "fake" i.e. you can feel when no matter how hard you try, you just can't help but concede.

Maybe next year I will snag the game up on console - as the community does seem rather low - matchmaking can take a while and none of my PC friends play PES :(

I was earlier a fan of FIFA. I switched to PES in 2019, and have ever since been a fan of PES. It may lag FIFA in terms of official licenses and may be in commentary, but what really matters to me is the realistic gameplay experience and there is no comparison to PES in that regard.
You get Messi and Ronaldo as cover stars. What else do you want? Mbappe?

I said that this year I wont be buying this c*** but yet I bought it, the worst mistake. UNINSTALLED finally.

New year, same scripting and lagfest. 

Player responsiveness and awareness is non-existent. Defenders missing easy interceptions and ballwatching loose balls. Player switching always switching to the least needed player. Half the match you are not in control of your own players. 
Definitely not worth all the frustration that comes with that. 
Scripting feels heavier this time around. Especially on Matchday.
When none of that scripting happens, the game feels really nice and the game is a proper football game.
But, sadly, that doesn't happen very often. You can even tell when your opponent is on the losing side of scripting.
So, even when you win it feels like it's not because of your own skills.

Es gab mal eine Zeit in der die PES-Serie als eine gute und vor allem realistische Fußballsimulation galt. Bedauerlicherweise scheint diese Zeit vorbei zu sein. Aber fangen wir von vorn an...

Von den technischen Aspekten her ist das Spiel durchaus in Ordnung.
Recht moderate Systemanforderungen erlauben auch Besitzern älterer Systeme ein Spielen auf hohen Grafikeinstellungen. Überhaupt scheint es die Grafik des Spiels zu sein, die in den Releases der letzten Jahre konstant verbessert wurde (mein letztes PES war 2016). Auch die Soundkulisse ist sehr ordentlich, obwohl die Songs für den Soundtrack selbst vermutlich nicht jedermanns Geschmack treffen.

Damit erschöpft sich aber schon der positive Teil. Negativ zu bemängeln sind (in der deutschen Version) die kaum veränderten Kommentare. Die deutschen Reporter Hagemann und Küpper klingen bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen identisch wie in PES 2016, scheinbar hat man die Ansagen kontinuierlich weitergeschleppt. Diese klingen nicht nur langweilig, sondern sind auch immer wieder unzutreffend und die ausführlichen Monologe über das Wetter hätte man sich wirklich sparen können.

Zuvor haben andere Reviews die träge Steuerung moniert, dem muss ich leider zustimmen. Die Bewegungen sind zwar flüssig animiert, aber zwischen dem Auslösen einer Aktion und der Reaktion des gesteuerten Spielers vergeht gefühlt eine Ewigkeit (zumindest ist es eine Ewigkeit wenn der Gegner zwischenzeitlich nochmals eine Haken schlagen kann o.ä.).

Sehr schlimm ist auch das Verhalten der Schiedsrichter zu deuten. Das war auch schon in früheren Version so und ich hatte erwartet das es Konami über mehrere Jahre hinbekommt, den Schiedsrichtern so etwa wie Fingerspitzengefühl einzuprogrammieren. Leider unterscheiden diese weiterhin strikt nach Schwarz oder Weiß, also Foul oder nicht.
Tacklings kann man damit fast völlig vergessen, nahezu jedes Tackling was den Gegner ein wenig aus dem Tritt bringt wird als Foul gesehen und wohl nahezu immer mit einer Verwarnung geahndet. Allerdings gelingt es der KI irgendwie immer solche Tacklings perfekt anzusetzen oder nur soviel zu schubsen/ziehen/zerren das es gerade so durchgeht -> somit fühlt sich er Referee parteiisch an und dem gesamten Spiel wird der körperliche Aspekt genommen. Man fühlt sich wie beim Schachspiel, alles passiert auf rein taktischer Ebene und das ist für ein Fußballspiel zu einseitig.

Im Modus BAL verkommt das Spiel zu einer Komödie. Es scheint ein ungeschriebenes Gesetz zu sein, das jeder zweite Ball beim Gegner landet. Stellungsspiel ist für die KI-Mitspieler ein Fremdwort, statt einen freien Mitspieler drei Meter neben sich anzuspielen wird der Ball aus der eigenen Hälfte sinnlos nach vorn gebolzt. Selbst für spielerisch limitierte Mannschaften ist das unsinnig. Jede Schülermannschaft hat mehr Spielverständnis...

Aus meiner Sicht ist PES 2021 keine Empfehlung wert. Es ist zwar nicht wirklich schlecht, aber gut ist es ebenfalls nicht und der oft beworbene Realismus bleibt leider wegen der Unzulänglichkeiten auf der Strecke. Einzig der aktuelle Preis von nur 24 € tröstet etwas über diese hinweg.

+++

A long time ago the PES series stood for a good and realistic soccer simulation. These times seem to be over...

At first hand the game is quiet okay. Very good visuals even on average systems pleasing the eye.  It is mostly the graphics that developed over the past years. Also sound effects are pretty nice although the soundtrack is not everybody's taste.

So much for the good parts. Bad is the mostly unchanged comments, seems like KONAMI only added y few lines (and most of them about the weather conditions).I'm speaking here of the german comment, can't tell about other languages. Some sentences were even left unchanged compared to PES 2016.

Movement is somewhat sluggish, reactions of both your players and your teammates are poor but at least are animated well.

One of the worst things is the referee. Simply because it is either a foul or not he doesn't show any kind of sure instinct. This mostly results in a card once you go for a tackle. Surely the computer is mostly doing it right.... This (among other things) makes the referee appear not neutral and draws the physical aspects out of the game.

Hilarious is the BAL game mode. Seems like every second ball must land right in front of the feet of an enemy player. Positioning as well as passing seem to be foreign words for your team mates. They do like it better to plow the ball away instead of passing it to a free player a few yards away. Even for limited teams this not a realistic behaviour. It hurts...

So the current game is not really recommended. It lacks what made the series great and successful - realism. Only the current price of 24 € can comfort a bit.

Hope someone will make like a no scripting movement to make sport games fair to encourage to not buy their games for a year - this is the only way to stop this nonsense as otherwise it will be only worst year by year.

I want to preface this review by saying its been a few years since I played either PES or FIFA, so I'm coming to this game with a fresh and unbiased mind.

This game is not fun to play. I've genuinely tried to enjoy it, yet its numerous glaring flaws make that hard. Some of its issues include:

- Players so stupid it seems a prerequisite to have the majority of your brain scooped out with a soup spoon before you're deemed eligible to ascend to the status of PES AI.

- Chief among these endless dumb-dumb moments is the perpetual AI ball-watching. They seem to forget that they are in fact not spectators and have a responsibility to react to the ball. 

-You could stick 11 Roombas on the pitch and they would make more intelligent off the ball runs.

- Terrible foul detection. The opposition team could come to where I live, kneecap the family, urinate on my plants and dance around my burning house and it wouldn't be deemed a foul. 

- Players have the turning circle of a moderately sized planet.  Seriously though, if i wanted to feel like I was controlling an M4 Sherman Medium Tank I would have played Battlefield 1942. The agility is non existent and they're about as fun to control as broken glass is to eat.

I know the measured and adult response to any sort of criticism of the game is often "git gud scrub". However, I don't see the point when the game itself can't even "git gud". My advice is to wait until the next one and see if that's any better.

[list]

    [*]if you know that this year is even worse than last year's iteration, 
    [*]if you know that you never know if it was actually you who won this match or if simply the script was on your side this time around,
    [*]if you cannot be certain that you just won a game because of your skill, because you took the effort to look for a particular manager or crafted some well thought-out tactics and formation, because you carefully chose your players to fit into this, perhaps even bought good ones with real monies, and because you also trained them - if you cannot be certain of this satisfaction because your victory may have been decided by the script,

    [*][b]if you know that nothing you ever do in this game actually matters,[/b]
[/list]

then you will not be able to enjoy this game.

So do yourself a favor and do not investigate about SCRIPTING.

The biggest downside to me is that I can't ever find online matches with my play level at all, I get destroyed every single match and if I narrow the mmr I can't find a match. The game itself is an improvement from PES 2020 and it seems quite nice.
The more you play the game though, the more you start getting angry at the way it is designed.
It is very similar to FIFA concerning the difficulty of the game:
-AI is insanely good at predicting your passes and movements
-Sometimes your players simply stop their run forward, just as you are passing the ball to them and the AI gets the ball for free
-The stats are completely out of balance with Atal scoring a volley-first-time shot from 35m out into the Top corner
-Sometimes the game is super easy and you win 3-0 no problem and then the next game your players are very slow, play horrendous passes and the AI simply lobs in long balls, then lays it off (because they ALWAYS win headers, even when you use super cancelling) and their striker puts it in

To conclude, it feels much like a simulated game with you being in the string puppet trying to influence the game. It seems as if the outcome of the game is already decided before you even kick off and the best things is when the AI plays ridiculously good in the second half after a bad first half and simply nets in 3 goals after you were 1-0 and that's how you loose in this game.
You simply do not have fun playing offline against the AI, because you have some games with only a little scripting, which are actually fun and then there are 2 games in a row where you could also put the controller aside and just let the AI do it alone and you wait until the scripted matches are over.

This game has great potential but to be honest, once you play this game, it is not as good as it says. First of all, the refree system is a joke. Crucial last man tackle is just a yellow card and sometimes obvious fouls are not awarded. The controls for this game is quite confusing as it requires you to constantly release all controls of your controller and do nothing until your player receives the ball if not some weird passes or actions will happen. As for online mode, the input lag is so bad that it's impossible to build up an attack. As soon as you want to pass, the lag will delay it for 1 or 2 seconds. Thus your passing is like last-minute passes everytime. The opponent (with better internet) will easily counter attack you and score non stop. I regretted playing the online mode and spending some money on it. You can never win against a player with better internet because of your location. Everything is just lag. Can't attack, can't defend. Even the passes from top midfielders isn't even good. The players wont receive the ball properly at all. For offline mode is ok, but for online mode, its better if you just don't play.

In my first season after 15 years since i last played PES, i managed to reach 2nd spot in the table. It wasnt easy as you need to focus and be determined. So ya, you don't need mod or patch to fix the gameplay, just change the formation will do. Enjoy.

I'm only writing this because there's another steam update that's taking forever but I will start with the negatives.
1. There is no offline play. Or at the very least you have to be online when you start the game.
2. It's really difficult to find people to play with online.
3. This game frequently crashes for no reason and is very buggy.

Overall PES is a very frustrating experience and I do not recommend this game to people who have not previously played PES or FIFA...but if you have and you really love football then yes buy this game.

I bought this game out of desperation. Why? Because fifa 21 is so bad its unplayable
So I decided to give pes a go. 
Saying its better than fifa 21 is like saying night follows day. 
PES 21 is a very poor game. The gameplay is sterile and lifeless. I played master league. I can forgive the menu system etc if the gameplay was decent. But its not decent. My teams just stands watching. theres no dynamic movement. No cpu intuition. No excitement.
Its not worth saying any more about this dull and boring game.
Its better than fifa 21 but it could not be possibly worse.
My advice?
Don't waste your money on either games

There are a lot of comments in the discussion tab about online cheaters, but I don't play online so I don't have experience of that. Offline, the game is engaging and satisfying to play. Yes, it lacks the league depth of Fifa, but I personally feel the graphics are better in PES and the game play is SO much better. It feels like you have full control of the players, tricks are difficult to master but satisfying when they come off, the AI is not too strict or too lax, and if you pop over to one of the modding sites, you have extra leagues and kit packs. The interface has not had an overhaul from the previous version, but the tweaks to the match engine make for a more fluid game.

OK game, but I wouldn't recommend it to most people. Online gameplay is frustratingly terrible.
Single player feels fine to play, because the AI is terrible at capitalizing on your "mistakes", and thus makes it less agonizing to deal with. I wrote "mistakes" like this, because defensive errors rarely feel like your own faults, and moreso a combination of input lag, an inability of getting to control the correct player, and just people you have covering passing lanes flatout refusing to intercept balls. This happens multiple times each game, and most of the goals you score and concede will happen because of a mix of these things.

MyClub is the PES equivalent of Fifa's Ultimate Team, and I prefer it to FUT in everything except gameplay. You actually have the ability of improving your players through training, and Konami is quite generous with the ingame currency, and rare cards aren't as hard to come by as on fifa. That said, that's where it ends for me. I was quite enjoying single player for a while until I realized the only reason I was enjoying it was because I was winning a lot, since the AI is piss easy to beat. They fall into patterns way too much to be considered a challenge, even on the highest difficulties. Also there is little to no single player content, and in most of the matches you will play online you'll face teams with 5 legends (think Beckham, Puyol, young Messi), because of a glitch that allowed people to buy special editions of this game multiple times and acquire these cards. Most of the time they will use a 4-3-3 or a 4-3-1-2 and crowd the middle, only playing 1-2 passes which are very low-risk-high-reward since defending is such a crapshoot.


All in all, the game isn't all terrible, only the gameplay sucks. I feel like a large number of positive reviews stem from the fact that Fifa is also a crap game, and the PES community enjoys feeling like they are superior for not playing Fifa.

I played this game for less than 2 hours just to have a refund. I played a lot of fifa 20 and used to be a big PES fan back in the day and decided to give this new one a try. It was a big unpleasant surprise for the couple of games I played. At first I thought that maybe I wasn't enjoying it because I'm used to fifa's gameplay, but even with that aside the game didn't make me feel good when scoring a goal. Instead of a "YESS, ONE - NULL BABY", it was more like "wow, finally a ball who doesn't hit the post". In about 2 games, I hit the post 8 times, four each match. The passing is very inconsistent, often times the ball just goes through your player and he loses possession when trying to run after it. Also, almost everytime you try to tackle will result in a foul. 

In summary, I like to play offline better, and this is my personal view. PES 2021 was a big let down with unresponsive and slow actions from the player that often times resulted in an action that I did not intended and almost every game feels like just running after the ball especially if the AI decides to keep the possession.

Important point: I left 2020 a negative review.  

All of my major complaints about 2020 are fixed. It's now the beautiful engine from the last game, but you're allowed to tackle. 

tbh this is how PES has always been. The honesty this round is refreshing. While I'm intrigued by the next engine, I now actually enjoy playing in the current engine. 

If you played 2020, you'll likely turn the commentary off. Some of the classics are back - sparkling save etc. Also the commentator in my last game accused me of being shaky at the back recently - I literally haven't conceded a goal since I intalled the game.

Full disclosure I've only played 3 games (normal, normal, professional). Professional feels fair now that you can tackle, and I suspect I'll up the difficulty again - as opposed to deleting 2020 because the ref AI wouldn't stop cheating me.

PvP so far, experience worse than last time round. 2020 you had this 10 game grace period where you could play against people of a similar level in tight, fun games, before kicking you out of that so you just get smashed by Real Madrid/Munich every game after that. 

In 2021 you don't have that 10 game buffer, so far I've played 8 games online and have been smashed by Madrid in 4, Munich 3. Fair play to whoever smashed me as Roma, at least that was original.
It's a good soccer game, and very fun to play local coop.

Full disclosure, This is my first PES game ever, I've always been a FIFA player. This year I decided to jump ship over to PES, seeing that I like a more realistic and slow paced game compare to the AIDS that FIFA is.

Pros
- Master League : I am absolutely having a blast with ML, it's such a fresh change compared to Career mode from fifa. Every match feels realistic and something I have to fight for even if its against a relegation contender. Love the little cut scenes but they do get repetitive after the first season. I wish there were some more cutscenes, other than that ML has been what I've played majority of my 50 hours with so far.

- Gameplay : Ooh boy is the gameplay fluid and realistic at the same time. No two matches feel same, AI changes their tactics by recognizing patterns in the play, forcing me to change my play style. There are some annoying issues like the Referees being very inconsistent, Lack of injuries, and the Player switching Bug which causes players to loose momentum when i switch (not always). The ball physics are breath taking, watching my wing backs hurl in crosses is a joy to watch.

Cons : 

MyClub : So far I have had a hard time trying to find anyone to play against in MyClub, Finding online matches takes 10+ minutes at times and even when I do find a match, the connection is extremely poor. I havent been able to finish any of my 5 matches I have played so far in MyClubs. This could be a region specific issue, I am not sure.

Presentation : Coming from fifa, the presentation in PES leaves a lot to be desired, but looking at how solid the gameplay is, I am pretty sure this will be what they start focusing more on moving forward.

Overall, I feel its a Solid time to jump from the sinking ship that is FIFA, especially at the discounted price. I am really looking forward to a year filled with PES for me and already excited for the next year's PES with the Unreal engine!!

After 15 years of playing FIFA every year, I was finally converted to PES last year. FIFA feels better in some ways, but PES does in others. PES 2020 was a slower, more methodical game than FIFA, in which it mattered more what the stance of the player is when giving a pass than in FIFA, for instance, and where shots more easily just fly off into space if you don't choose carefully when to press the shoot button. Getting the hang of these mechanics often meant that goals scored were more satisfying because they felt more earned, and that appealed to me. PES also looks great in its own right, and has heaps of bespoke animations that can make certain team plays feel more unique. But on the flip side, FIFA's close control just feels better. In FIFA, all players feel like Messi-like geniuses of ball control and passing, whereas in PES, they feel like average footballers at times, but you can still pull off amazing moves with regularity if you learn how to manage the game's rhythm. There is a place for both of these styles to co-exist, in my opinion, with neither being outright better than the other.

That brings me to PES 2021. One of the reasons on-field players felt like less capable footballers at times in PES 2020 was because the close control simply felt bad. Tackle collisions felt like the ones you would have in FIFA 6 years ago, and the skill moves system, which supposedly had been upgraded with the input of Andrès Iniesta, was straight-up terrible in my opinion. Say what you will about momentum, but even the best players in the world moved like heavily-loaded trucks at times in PES 2020. Konami updated the game many times and at some point seemingly made the game play worse than before, but the final update in the summer made the game reasonably good. This positive endpoint came at the end of a long year of weird changes, though.

So, the biggest thing about PES 2021 is that it makes that gameplay feel even tighter than PES 2020 did at its most fluid best. The tweaks that have been made were small, but the sum of them is impactful for "feel" of the game: the  the skill move controls feel better, players are more responsive, and the whole game speed also seems slightly faster. What you end up with is a game that still has all of the things that made PES 2020 a very good football game on the pitch, and also has elements that make it feel closer to FIFA at times. PES 2021 feels more fluid than PES 2020 did. That said, FIFA is still a fair bit faster and more fluid still, so PES 2021 feels like the more deliberate game despite all of the above. They are still very different. 

There are still times when the game feels somewhat stilted though; it is no FIFA. Off the pitch, the game is also genuinely unchanged, with menus that look more aged than time itself. The manager mode is good, but nothing to get truly excited about. I don't play these games online at all, I simply stick to quick matches and the manager mode, so I can't comment on other aspects. 

The changes are welcome, though the game could still stand to have a slightly better flow at times. And it is by no means FIFA, even though it feels faster than last year. But to sum it up: the on-field action is great. If the game had been completely unchanged from last year, like the marketing blurb on the Steam page says it would be, saying whether or not it was worth the 25 - 30 euros would be more difficult. But the improved gameplay for me easily makes it worth upgrading to me. If upgraded squads and slightly but noticeably improved gameplay sound like they might be worth the budget price to you, I can recommend you to get it.

Been a PES fan for decades, but it's getting harder and harder to stay loyal. 

The AI seems to get dumber with every iteration. Thankfully this is the last one on the Fox Engine, which has been a dreadful engine for PES. 

Pros: Great player likenesses. Great lighting and shadow effects. Dribbling is very good (although ruined by dumb AI moving out your way). Full Manual controls in enjoyable. 

Cons. Very stupid AI who constantly move out of your way instead of trying to tackle you. CPU controlled teammates unaware the ball is right in front of them, so they don't take possession of it and the game doesn't change you into that player, forcing your to give up possession. Player switching is terribly inconsistent. Presentation and commentary is stuck in 2010. Midfield is not required, the game is simply about who can score the most, ignoring the fact in real football you can defend well and steal the win with a single goal. Referees are completely useless, blatant fouls are let go, whilst clean tackles are punished. 

Ultimately, i play this game simply for my love of football, but i don't recommend it. And wouldn't even call it enjoyable. The AI is far too dumb, the game leans far too much towards attacking, rendering the midfield pointless and the defence an afterthought. The frustrations far outweigh the enjoyable parts. 

PES used to be a tactical battle, in terms of formations, tactics and lineups along with midfield battles and decision making like when to press, when to sit, when to push forward. Now its just a sprint and shoot game, like FIFA. 

Thankfully, the Fox engine is dead and Konami are moving to Unreal. Hopefully they can recapture what PES used to be. Because the last few games have been abysmal and un-enjoyable.

Been playing PES for almost a decade now, here's my take.

Pros:
	Pacing: I can say that the pacing of the game is spot-on, a huge difference from the 2020 version, which had pretty horrendous gameplay.
	Graphics: Pretty good.
	AI makes better tactical decisions.
Cons:
	Online: Takes way too long to find an online opponent, high latency.
	Bugs: Players randomly letting the ball slip by them, players with 80+ passing screwing up simple passes, CPU scoring off every free kick.
	CPU takes advantage of "turn and shoot" gimmick, my defender will be glued to the striker when suddenly the striker turns and shoots effortlessly while not even facing the goal, goes in 75% of the time.
	Fouls: BLATANT fouls being simply IGNORED by the referees.
	Goalkeepers: Please fix the animations. When they dive they look like they're flying like superman.
	More fitting styles for kits: The player models are good, but the shirt sizing is somewhat wonky, perhaps add a tight kit option that fits more snug to the torso.

After announcing this year would be a simple update and offering the game for a cheaper price, I decided to give PES a try after dropping it in favor of FIFA almost 10 years ago.
Well, it's not good at all.
- This game smells like a sloppy console port with very little care for the PC version. The guy who designed those menus should be fired, it's the worst user experience I've seen in a while. Options locations don't make sense.
- Players are sluggish, defenses are through the roof, AI suck. AI will ignore balls within their reach, they won't fight or attempt anything to catch balls passing nearby.
- No bundesliga. Like, the UCL winner isn't in the game...
- Why only english commentaries are available?
- Game is so grossly rigged it's absolutely ridiculous. AI will have unstoppable momentums and you can just sit and watch them score perfect goals, walking over your players. It was like that on PES 5, now 10 years later Konami still thinks it's a good gameplay feature. 

I'm still gonna favor FIFA this year.

This is a good football game. The game feels more natural and free-flowing than FIFA in that nothing feels scripted. Like if you shoot a rocket it could deflect off the keeper and into the net based on game physics while in FIFA it is a scripted save. 

But what separates it from being a good game to a great game is the foul system. it really needs fixing. I am yet to get a penalty kick awarded from blatant fouls ( One frustrating example is how my Salah was pushed in the penalty box but ref did not call it.) Worse, the AI ref punishes you heavily. You will be penalized for legal challenges so you are forced to be too cautious. I've conceded goals based on fears that my challenge might lead to a free kick (which the AI will very likely score if just outside the box) or PK. The developers really need to fix this.

They said it's not a new game, just a season update, but it's actually a lot more-
All the new things included in pes 20 like first touch, ball physics, physical contact between players, game speed during the match, etc. are all things that have been revisited and perfected.
The AI of the players you don't have control over has improved dramatically, fewer random spaces in defense taking goals on stupid counter-attacks and also improved the referee (although not perfect yet).
All these improvements make pes 21 the perfect football simulation, pes 20 had already made a big leap, but pes 21 is a perfected title.
Recommended!

Great game

But buying it when its on sale

Pluses: Satisfying gameplay, Master League is pretty fun, licenses aren't an issue since it's very easy to just install Option File fixing the fake teams. MyClub is fun as card-collecting mode. Game runs smoothly during gameplay* in 60FPS on a far from top PC (i-3 4160, R9 270, 8GB RAM DDR3) on medium settings. (Drops to 50-55 on high)

*excluding cutscenes/celebration close-ups, it's not a big issue since you don't control anything at those moments

Minuses: Online. Haven't found a match earlier than 10 minutes in yet. Connection tends to worsen A LOT during the match itself (and no, it's not an issue with my internet). MyClub has way less functions than FUT; and there aren't any special modes offline - player career, manager career, quickplay, that's about it.

$25 vs $70 is a good argument though



Summary: if you want to hop in once in a while, play a few games, maybe lead a club for a few seasons, make a nice squad in online card-collecting mode without the need for spending hundreds of bucks - take PES.

If you just want to grind/spend some money instead in an online mode, or have a wider choice of gamemodes - think you'd be better off getting FIFA.

Here's an honest review after an hour and 20 minutes of gameplay. For those people looking to buy this game because of huge improvements in gameplay and other new features, you are going to be dissappointed. This as most of you may be aware is just a season update, hence no significant gameplay changes. So why should I upgrade from Pes 2020, you may ask? Well if you are looking to play online, then it is must. There are also tiny gameplay changes such as minor tweaks to passing and dribbling which make it bit more bearable. Another thing is the pitches have finally been realistically designed as opposed to the arcady pitches in 2020. The passing is totally realistic and feels more crisper this year compared to last year. The UI has been slightly more polished. For those who are solely interested in offline modes such as Master League, you will be dissappointed as they are largely the same as 2020.One con i can think of is the dribbling where players often run into each other instead of avoiding or going around them.; or when a slow ass player manages to outrun speedy players., This is one of the areas which MUST be addressed in PES 2022. Another issue is the shooting mechanic, specially the finesse/curling shots which still feel like slow motion. This is one area where PES can massively improve over FIFA. Finally the pricing of the game at £24.99/ $30 may feel like a bit much for just a season update. Personally I would have priced this around $5 dollar less but its not like FIFA every year where they make miniscule changes and charge a premium price.To sum up , Pros-1. Best Football Simulator in 2020.2. Passing is the best ever designed in a football game3. The customizations such as adding stadiums, teams and leagues as well as other stuff like scoreboards, adboards, chants etc.Cons- 1. Dribbling needs to be improved significantly.2. Shooting feels the same as 2020, like the slow motion curling shots3. Price of $30 may be a bit much for just minor changesOverall Rating - 7.5/10

Hello, I'll review this game from my POV.  I'm coming from FIFA and this game is worth it for me. Gameplay is miles better. This game is worth it at full price if you dont own PES 20 or if you want to playPES 21 myclub.  If you have PES 20 and don't play online then it's not worth.  If all you wanna do is play offline mode such as MyLeague (Manager career mode on fifa) this game is currently not worth it because the full transfer update won't be released until October 22th. This is because of Covid19 but still sucks for us. Only some of the transfer are already made. As an example for Arsenal, they have Willian but Gabriel is still at Lille.  Overall it's worth it if you dont own 20 already or if you want to play online. Miles better than FIFA tho. I hope this helped

I gave same chance last year to PES 2020 and was a huge disappointment after I have played the demo. The final release was just a nightmare and I hastly requested a refund though. 

I tried to give one more chance to PES with the 2021, because basically FIFA went nuts with UT and ridicolous game modes like Volta (jeez that was seriously abysmal).

So this was more an act of desperation and... surprise, surprise...

this time it paid off at least about the gameplay. 

This new release imo is smooth and very close to what I played in the 2020 demo and for the first time in years I had fun playing with PES. 

There are some negative aspects that I noticed so far,the  lack of official licenses (is a war between Konami and EA), the referee whistle is so unnatural and the menu is counterintuitive.

 For example to exit to desktop ya gotta click options. 

The ML is nice, but the menu is awful at the best, the contents are nice and also a lot of good features to go in depth in the training to let your players grow as you desire, and this is FAR better than the lazy FIFA system. 

I will try to update this review, but if you are truly pissed off from EA laziness as I am, give to PES2021 a try!

It may only be a slightly updated game but some of the new animations for the players is a delight as they really try to win and fight for balls in new ways. The game was great for 2020 and it still is. Had this game been full priced and tweaked then it would be getting negative reviews, but this simple update that I think should happen every year is a nice wee way to cap off 25 years of this beautiful football game. I do believe the master league needs updated as it is as was and yes a great improvement over yester-years but not much of a change from last year. Great music as always and perfect menu system and controlls. I will be looking forward to the next gen yearly games but hopefully they will consider this new update idea or atleast do it half way through a season to tweak an already great game. Good on Konami putting up a good fight!!!
